title: E-Commerce DTC Video Editor
description:
Overview

We are looking for a full-time remote Video Editor to join our team and take ownership of our creative production. This person will handle UGC ads, mashups, testimonials, social media edits, B-rolls, and TikTok/Reels-style ads - primarily for
, Instagram, and TikTok ads.

The role requires someone who is both a strong storyteller (finding the narrative in raw content) and a skilled editor (using techniques to make ads more engaging and conversion-driven).



Output Expectation

15–25 edited videos per week

Mix of ad styles: UGC, testimonial, social content, mashups, B-roll, TikTok/Reels



Core Responsibilities

Select the best clips from a large pool of raw content and assemble them into engaging stories

Edit UGC and testimonial footage into performance-driven ads

Add motion graphics, text overlays, subtitles, pop-ups, stickers, and other visual enhancements to make content engaging

Balance storytelling flow with editing craft (cutting, pacing, transitions, visuals)

Contribute creative input — propose editing strategies, variations, and ideas to improve performance

Maintain organized project structures and content libraries using naming conventions

Deliver consistent, high-quality edits on time



Required Skills & Experience

Strong editing & storytelling fundamentals.

Advanced editing capabilities: motion graphics, animated text, visual effects, pop-ups, stickers, etc.

Proven ability to create ads for DTC e-commerce / performance marketing 
, TikTok, Instagram)

Ability to turn raw UGC into polished, engaging ad creatives

Minimum 2–3 years of relevant experience (agency or e-commerce brand) — ideally with exposure to Western markets (US/Europe)

Strong sense of storytelling, able to create engaging narratives that convert viewers into buyers

Highly organized with experience in content library management and naming conventions

Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently with general briefs



Workstyle & Personality

Independent problem-solver — can take a general direction and fill in the gaps

Mix of speed and quality: able to deliver fast but still maintain high editing standards

Responsible, proactive, and up for a challenge

Strong communicator in English

- Answer client messages within 24 hours

- Host weekly group calls and 1-on-1 coaching sessions

- Help clients overcome content blocks and limiting beliefs



Progress Tracking:



- Update daily/weekly reports

- Track client progress and next steps

- Join daily team check-ins

- Ensure clients follow strategies consistently



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)



- C1+ English (written and spoken) with no accent

- Strong communication skills

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment



IMPORTANT



When recording a Loom video as part of your application:



- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Content creation and social media experience

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts

- Regular usage of AI tools (ChatGPT, CapCut)



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $935 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,100 a month)

Note: More experienced CSMs earn between $1,800 and $2,500 after 6-12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $900+ additional monthly based on:

- Client retention rates

- Task completion metrics

- Quality of feedback

- Team collaboration

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise directly to your bank

- Tools access: We'll cover all the needed tools

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Regular feedback and skill development



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CSM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with client management.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio.



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.



P.S. Young Publisher is the recruitment company. Successful candidates will work under Social Influence Consulting LLC.

title: Experienced Assistant - AI Consulting Business Operations (20-40hrs/week)
description:
Hi



My name is Howie! Thanks so much for reading this job posting. A little about me before jumping into the role: I'm a fun, friendly 30 year old software engineer living in California. I train Jiu Jitsu most days, travel a lot, do camping/road trips, am creative in both my work and personal life, and do amateur photo/videography that I'm going to start making content with. I live an active life and it's about to get more busy as I've just launched my consulting business and it's already moving fast. The rest of this job posting is dense and overwhelming so wanted to show that I was a real person first, not some business executive.



My 

My LinkedIn: 

Business page: 





ABOUT THE ROLE

---------------



I run a consulting business based in San Francisco and Miami where I provide guidance on companies' operations, build any software they may need, and connect them to any new AI tools that would make them more efficient. Clients include tech startups, accounting firms, a law firm and individuals so far, so you'll get exposure to those industries. It's been one month but already I need help as I'm being quickly referred by my existing clients. My 3 month goal is to grow this from just me to an agency with other engineers, a designer, video editor, content/marketing. I need a sharp, resourceful assistant like you to be an extension of me in my personal life and for the business.



- The 20hrs/week for me will be a mix of my personal tasks and tasks for the business. If we end up needing more hours that's no problem for me, just estimating 20hrs for now.

- You'll also have the option to work 10hrs/week for my sister and her fiance's accounting firm that they run (or if you know anyone feel free to refer them)

- Then there will be frequent opportunities for you to do work directly for our clients as needed. For instance, if the law firm has a project they need help with. This can pay $7/hr.





WHY WORK WITH ME

-----------------



You won't be doing repetitive work. This is a dynamic, high-trust position. Here's what makes this worth your time:



You'll work with the latest AI tools - I use and build AI tools for a living. I live in Silicon Valley so I'm the first to hear about any new tools, and I get to meet a lot of the people building them. You'll be using those same tools daily. I hope we can work together forever but if not you'll come out of this role with hands-on experience that you can put on your resume or use to start your own business!



You'll learn my productivity systems - I work fast and efficiently. Together we'll create systems to get things done faster than 99% of the world. I invest in making us better - if you need something to do work more efficiently it's yours. If you want to develop a skill that will help the business go for it. The skills we build together will be beneficial for any future position.



You'll gain experience across multiple industries.



There's a real growth path - The right person's responsibility and pay will grow with the company.





SCHEDULE & COMPENSATION

------------------------



Hours: 20-40 hrs/week as stated above

Availability: Mostly on your own time but some work (like calling businesses) will need to be done during Pacific Time business hours: 9AM - 5PM PST. And I'm sometimes busy with clients during those hours so if you and I need to meet then it might be done outside of those hours e.g. 8AM or 6pm PST. So flexibility is a plus.

Rate: $5-7/hr USD (based on experience). Any ad hoc work for other clients billed at $7/hr.

Growth: Compensation reviews at 3 months and 6 months





WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

---------------------



Business Tasks



- Researching and trialing new tools and services and reporting back on whether they're worth it

- Finding and vetting video editors for both business and personal content. Sourcing a designer for brand and visual identity work. Finding a front-end software engineer for project-based work. Identifying someone to help with brand strategy and content creation. A part-time junior software engineer

- Drafting and editing client
s and cold outreach in a real person's voice

- Industry research: What AI tools are being adopted in accounting? What does a mid-size law firm's tech stack look like?

- Setting up and optimizing the business profiles across platforms: Creating and optimizing profiles on Google Business Profile, LinkedIn Services, Clutch, G2, Yelp Business, and other relevant directories for consultants

- Conducting a digital presence audit - searching for the business across Google, LinkedIn, and other platforms, documenting where we rank, who appears above us, and identifying specific opportunities to improve visibility

- Seeing what other agencies do, copying them, maybe reaching out to work together or become friends

- Project manager - coordinating with me, clients and contractors

- Administration e.g. managing expenses in Quickbooks



Personal Tasks



- Managing schedules

- Making calls to US businesses on my behalf - banks, government agencies, insurance companies, service providers

-
ing companies for customer support

-
 management: cleaning up inboxes, following up on deliveries

- Sourcing things I need to buy from
 Marketplace, Amazon, eBay

- Researching and booking travel arrangements: hotels, campgrounds, events, interesting stops, scenic routes, activities, events, restaurants

- Reaching out to professional services for things like moving, printing services, etc





TOOLS

------



You do NOT need experience with most of these. Having experience is a plus. What matters most is that you can pick up new tools quickly e.g. via YouTube tutorial. That's the skill I care about. Though some of these are very useful for any work you may do so even if you don't apply I highly recommend looking into them!



- Slack - communication, task assignment

- Loom - video recording. Besides Slack we'll be communicating through video more than anything

- Claude / ChatGPT (will ask to see your chat history because there are smart ways to communicate with these. This is the best way I can see how you think)

- Zapier / Make / n8n - workflow automation (HUGE plus if you have experience here!)

- Bitwarden - password and credential management (like LastPass or 1Password)

- OpenPhone or Google Voice - US business phone number

- Linear - task management (like Jira)

- Todoist - personal task management

- Wispr Flow - voice-to-text dictation

- Granola - AI meeting notes

- Google Workspace

- Canva - light design work

- Superhuman - high-speed
 management

- Notion - documentation and SOPs

- Perplexity - AI-powered research

- Claude Cowork - desktop automation agent (big plus if you have experience here)

- Tango - step-by-step guides and SOP creation

- Toggl Track - time tracking and reporting





QUALIFICATIONS

---------------



First thing's first - if your application sounds like it was generated by AI, I'll ignore it. That doesn't mean don't use AI to help write it - I'm using it to help me write this posting. But I'm editing it heavily so that it has my voice. A real voice. Your work will involve the same - clients don't want to get
s that sound like AI. So your application is the first test of this.



Must-haves:



- Strong written and spoken English. Reliable internet. Quiet environment to make calls.

- Available for a 2-3 hour window during US Pacific business hours (PST)

- Day to day flexibility would be really great. You can mostly do tasks whenever best for you but I might ask for things at any point during my day - like making a cool graphic for a last minute client presentation - and it would be nice if you were available.

- Available (some) Saturdays. Since I'm busy with clients during the week, my personal tasks end up on the weekends. Can work this out - maybe Sunday and one weekday off, and if we agree to work on off days we can do so at a higher rate.

- High agency - you take initiative and ownership, solve problems before being asked

- Attention to detail - you have high standards and double-check that all instructions were followed before completing a task

- Comfort with technology and a demonstrated ability to learn new tools independently

- Experience making phone calls to US businesses on behalf of a client



Strong pluses:



- Experience with any of the Business or Personal work listed above

- Strong background in computers e.g. IT

- Any content creation background (graphics, photoshop, video editing, social media)

- Background in marketing, SEO, branding, or helping grow a business's online presence

- Strong written and spoken Spanish

- Familiarity with business administration or bookkeeping

- Experience with any of the Business or Personal tasks listed above - please note them in your application!

- Trustworthy
, LinkedIn profiles



Dream bonus (not expected):



- Experience with Zapier, n8n, Make, or similar automation tools

- Junior-level software engineering skills

- Experience as a travel agent or travel planning professionally





HOW TO APPLY

-------------



Please engage with the business page I just created - follow, like, comment





Send a resume with references



Part 1: Video Introduction

Record a video introducing yourself, your experience in general, and your experience with any of the work or tools listed above. I'm big on "show vs tell" so if you have samples of your work or can show off some of your workflow that would be amazing. Even if you script this try to sound natural!



Part 2: Sample Task

Quickly find some software or AI consultant or consulting firm based in Miami and write up an analysis on them - could be their website, their services, their clients, their marketing. Then write them an
 (don't send it) saying what interests you about them and how our businesses could potentially collaborate. Using AI is completely ok just remember in the end it has to sound human. Bonus points if this is all shown in the video, but can also just paste the write-up and
 in your application.





WHAT HAPPENS NEXT

------------------



I'd like someone to be fully onboarded by March 16 (PST) but I'm tied up during the week this month so would be great if someone was available March 14 (Saturday) and/or March 15 (Sunday) just this once for onboarding. If these dates don't work for you let me know we'll work around it.



- March 9-13: Top 5-10 applicants will be invited to do a paid task ($5 USD) to evaluate your speed, how you figure things out, and your communication style.

- March 14: Top ~5 candidates will be invited to a video interview. To make sure we're a good fit! Will notify everyone of results on this day.

- March 15: Selected candidate starts onboarding.



I am always looking to help - if you make it to the final rounds where we meet but don't end up working together, I will keep your name in mind any time I hear of someone needing VA support.



I'm so so so so excited to work with you!!! Thank you

title: Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager (D2C E-commerce Coffee Brand) *Full Time | Remote (Asia Time Zone)
description:
Innovative global coffee brand inventing one-of-a-kind tools redefining how coffee is experienced. Seeking a Marketing Operator to own campaigns, launches, and cross-channel execution alongside founders.





ABOUT ICOSA BREWHOUSE:

ICOSA Brewhouse is a globally recognized specialty coffee brand redefining how coffee is experienced. We are shaping coffee culture around the world. (
  / 
 )



We design and invent one-of-a-kind tools that didn’t exist before — tools that elevate everyday rituals and introduce new ways of enjoying coffee.



From record-breaking Kickstarter launches to collaborations with world-class coffee professionals, our products are used by champions, in top cafés, and in homes in 100+ countries around the world. 



We are a design-led, innovation-driven brand operating in a niche we are actively shaping. We build thoughtfully, test deliberately, and care deeply about quality — in both product and execution.



As we continue to innovate, launch new products, and grow, we are looking for a Senior Social Media & Marketing Manager to take ownership of how our work is brought to life across channels.



You won’t just publish content.



You’ll help shape how new products are introduced, how campaigns are structured, and how our global community experiences our brand — while ensuring execution remains disciplined, consistent, and scalable.







YOUR ROLE AND OPPORTUNITY ON THE TEAM:

This is a senior marketing operator role. Execution is central — but it is not a junior content posting role.



You will work directly with our Marketing Lead to:

• Own day-to-day marketing delivery across core channels

• Structure and execute campaigns from planning through rollout

• Translate ideas into clear, executable briefs

• Coordinate creative production across internal, outsourced, and AI-assisted workflows

• Strengthen how our marketing engine operates over time



You will see early product prototypes.

You will contribute to campaign discussions before launch.

You will help shape how innovation is presented to a global audience.



Execution is central to this role — but so is judgment, ownership, and the ability to think in campaigns rather than isolated posts.





What you’ll own:



(1) Marketing Execution Across Channels

• Own social media execution (Instagram and
).

• Plan and manage content calendars aligned with brand positioning.

• Ensure consistent publishing and follow-through across platforms.

• Manage inbox and community engagement, including partnership or influencer communication if required.

• Execute
 campaigns aligned with launches, promotions, and collaborations.



You ensure marketing execution remains structured, timely, and dependable.



(2) Campaign Rollout & Launch Execution

• Support and execute seasonal campaigns, product launches, collaborations, and promotional initiatives.

• Translate marketing objectives into structured creative briefs.

• Coordinate creative asset development across designers, freelancers, and AI-supported workflows.

• Oversee cohesive cross-channel rollout so messaging, visuals, and timing align across social,
, and paid efforts.

• Strengthen campaign structure and rollout processes over time.



You think in campaigns — not just content pieces.



(3) Creative Briefing & Quality Control

• Create clear, structured briefs for design and content production.

• Maintain high standards of aesthetic consistency, messaging clarity, and brand voice integrity across both human and AI-assisted workflows.

• Draft copy or guide AI-assisted content creation when needed, ensuring outputs remain on-brand and high quality.

• Review creative outputs for brand alignment before escalation to the Marketing Lead.

• Collaborate comfortably in tools such as Figma or similar platforms to support execution and alignment.



You don’t need to be a designer — but you should have strong creative judgment.



(4) Growth & Operational Development

• Identify opportunities to refine workflows and strengthen how our marketing engine operates.

• Lead or contribute to structured testing and rollout of new channels or initiatives as capacity allows.

• Over time, take increasing ownership of campaign structuring, cross-channel coordination, partnership campaign oversight, and creative alignment across performance-driven efforts.



As you demonstrate reliability and judgment, your scope expands meaningfully.





What success looks like:

• Social and
 channels operate smoothly with consistent execution and strong brand alignment.

• Campaigns are rolled out in a coordinated, cross-channel manner without last-minute chaos.

• Creative briefs are structured, clear, and reduce friction across collaborators.

• Marketing execution no longer bottlenecks leadership attention.

• Early experiments in new channels or initiatives are tested in a structured way.



Over time, you become a trusted execution leader within the marketing team.





What This Role Is Not:

• Not a pure content creator role.

• Not a brand strategist role.

• Not a paid media buyer role.

• Not an administrative coordinator role.



This is a senior marketing operator position inside a growing global brand.







ABOUT YOU / WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

You are someone who:

• Understands how structured marketing campaigns come together.

• Can translate ideas into clear execution plans.

• Is comfortable owning delivery without hand-holding.

• Is comfortable reviewing performance data and using insights to inform execution decisions.

• Is strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



You are strategic enough to think ahead — but practical enough to execute consistently.



Must have skills or experience:

• 4–6+ years of experience managing marketing and/or social for a brand.

• Experience executing structured marketing campaigns.

• Experience within D2C or product-based brands strongly preferred.

• Comfortable operating inside e-commerce environments.

• Highly detail-oriented and disciplined in follow-through.

• Strong creative judgment and ability to assess content quality and brand alignment.

• Comfort collaborating in design tools such as Figma.

• Comfortable working directly with founders in a small, fast-moving team.



Big pluses:

• Experience supporting product launches or crowdfunding campaigns.

• Experience creating, implementing, and refining marketing processes or building SOPs.

• Experience coordinating freelancers or creative collaborators.

• Familiarity with Klaviyo or similar
 platforms.

• Exposure to AI-assisted marketing workflows.







WHY JOIN US:

At ICOSA Brewhouse, you will:

• Work directly with founders who are deeply involved in product design, positioning, and global campaigns.

• Operate close to innovation — seeing products and launches before they are introduced to the world.

• Contribute to campaigns that reach a global coffee audience.

• Have real ownership inside a small, high-performing team where your work is visible and impactful.

• Help shape coffee culture around the world.



We are a fully remote team — but we operate with structure and discipline.



You’ll be joining a close-knit group focused on building something meaningful with collaboration and accountability. There is no office politics. No unnecessary hierarchy. Just people committed to high standards.



We care deeply about growth — not just as a company, but as individuals. As we expand, there are real opportunities to take on broader ownership, lead initiatives, and shape how our marketing evolves.



If you want a role where:

• Your ideas are heard.

• Your execution matters.

• Your scope can grow with your capability.

You will feel at home here.







COMPENSATION AND WORKING STRUCTURE

Full time: 40 hours/week 

Compensation range: $1,100-$1,800 (based on relevant experience and demonstrated capability)

Up to 16 days of paid time off annually

Asia time zone working hours required







HOW TO APPLY

Are you ready? 



If you’d like to join us on our journey and grow together with us, we’re looking forward to meeting you.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our application process extremely efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Complete the quick application: 
 

2. In the first question of the application start it with: "I’m (insert your name) from (insert your city/town) and my favourite food is (insert your favourite food). Then introduce yourself and why you think you’ll be a good fit for this position. 

3. We’ll be in touch with next steps for the interview once we receive it. 



We look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Influencer & Partnerships Coordinator (E-commerce Specialty Coffee Brand) *Part Time | Remote (Asia Time Zone)
description:
Innovative global coffee brand inventing one-of-a-kind tools redefining how coffee is experienced. We are looking for an Influencer & Partnerships Coordinator to build meaningful relationships across the coffee industry that support global campaigns and product launches.







ABOUT ICOSA BREWHOUSE:

ICOSA Brewhouse is a globally recognized specialty coffee brand reshaping coffee culture around the world. (
  / 
 )



We design one-of-a-kind tools that elevate everyday rituals and introduce new ways of enjoying coffee.



From record-breaking Kickstarter launches to collaborations with world-class coffee professionals, our products are used by champions, top cafés, and homebrewers across 100+ countries.



We are a design-led, innovation-driven brand operating in a niche we are actively shaping. We build thoughtfully, test deliberately, and care deeply about quality — in both product and execution.

WHY JOIN US:

At ICOSA Brewhouse, you will:

• Operate close to innovation. See products and launches before they are introduced to the world.

ou’ll be joining a close-knit team focused on building something meaningful through collaboration.

title: Canva / Photoshop Designer for Etsy Stores (Short-Term Project)
description:
Professional Product Image Designer – High Volume Work (Photoshop Expert Only)



I’m hiring a serious, high-level designer.



I own 10 online stores, each with approximately 80 products.

Each product includes 5 images that must be professionally redesigned, with heavy focus and premium quality on the main image.

The remaining images must follow a clean, consistent visual style.



Additionally, you will need to use AI tools to expand each product from 5 images to 10 images, while maintaining the brand identity of each store.



Requirements:



Ability to complete 1 full store per day (average)



Advanced-level Photoshop skills (mandatory)



Experience with additional professional design software



Strong understanding of branding and visual consistency



Fast turnaround and ability to handle high volume



Do NOT:



Ask about salary



Apply if you only use Canva



Apply if you are not confident working fast under pressure



Payment will reflect quality and efficiency.



If you believe you're qualified, I will send you a product via WhatsApp.

You will redesign it according to a style guide I provide.

If it takes too long, this job is not for you.



Thank you,

Shahar

title: Customer Experience & Operations Associate (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote | Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, benefits, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: Video Editor (B-Roll Focused – Talking Head Content)
description:
Rate: $2.5 per finished minute

(More consistent work available for strong performance.)



We’re looking for a skilled video editor who specializes in adding strong, relevant B-roll to talking-head content (finance/political style videos). This role focuses on clean editing and visual storytelling — no complex motion graphics or heavy effects required.

This is a long-term opportunity for the right editor.



Editing Style

For the reference video: 
 



We want you to observe:

How B-roll is placed





How it visually supports what the speaker is saying





How it enhances understanding without distracting





The overall edit does not need to be fast-paced. However, the B-roll placement should feel dynamic, intentional, and well-timed.



What We’re Looking For

Strong, relevant B-roll that directly supports the message





Good judgment in choosing visuals





No random or generic stock footage





Clear storytelling through visuals





The speaker should still appear on screen at times — this should not be pure B-roll throughout. However, B-roll should be prioritized so we can clearly evaluate your selection and storytelling skills.

title: Online Math/Science Teacher(Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: Product Listing Specialist for Ecom Fashion Store
description:
Hey there!



We’re looking for a Product Listing Specialist to join our Ecom Fashion Dropshipping Store.

We’re a fast-growing e-commerce company operating in the USA, currently processing around 50-100 orders per day.

We’re building a long-term team of A-players who want to grow with us — not just for a few weeks, but for the long run.



What We’re Looking For:



Minimum 1 year of experience in product listing or e-commerce operations.

Proven experience working for a store doing $100K+ in monthly revenue.

Comfortable working in Spreadsheets / Google Sheets for tracking and organizing listings.

Experience using Poky (for importing products) and Kiwi Sizing (for adding size charts).

Strong English skills — you must be able to translate, write and structure product titles and descriptions clearly.

High attention to detail — every product must be perfect before it goes live.

Consistent, reliable and organized — we don’t want to double-check every listing.

Availability to work also in the weekends.



Your Main Tasks:



Take researched products and list them accurately on our website.

Translate product descriptions and titles into proper English (according to our SOP template).

Add the correct size chart using Kiwi Sizing.

Upload all product photos, pricing, and details correctly.

Place the final product link back into our internal listing spreadsheet for review.

Communicate daily updates through Slack.



What We Offer:



Long-term position (we’re looking for someone to stay 6+ months minimum).

Flexible working hours depending on performance and communication.

Weekly or bi-weekly payouts (depending on agreement).

Communication and task management via Slack.

Growth opportunities within the team as we scale.

Bonus structure based on performance and accuracy.

Be skilled at creating collections, organizing the store in terms of product sizes and backgrounds.



What to Expect After You Apply:



If we think you’re a fit, we’ll send you a short video explaining exactly how we work, what your daily tasks will look like, and what we expect from you.

After watching the video, you can respond with your thoughts — and if it feels like a good match, we’ll schedule a call to discuss the next steps.



IMPORTANT!



Only apply if:



You’ve read this entire post carefully.

You meet all the requirements listed above.

You’re serious about joining a long-term team that values precision, structure, and consistency.

And you have watched this video: 



Remember, we are really looking for A players, so you must meet all the requirements, otherwise we cannot hire you.



Kindly regards,

Benjamin

title: Social Media Manager
description:
We are Singapore’s fastest growing performance marketing agency seeking

Social Media Manager

(1 full-time, remote position available)



You are a creative, strategic, and highly organized content creator who lives and breathes social media. You don’t just post for the sake of it — you understand the psychology of scroll-stopping content, the power of storytelling, and how to turn followers into fans, and fans into clients. You are data-driven, always testing what works, and you're obsessed with content that not only looks good — but converts.



We are Singapore’s fastest growing performance marketing agency that specialises in helping speakers, coaches, and service-based businesses build and scale million dollar offers through paid ads, funnels, and high-level mentorship.



We are seeking a Social Media Manager to drive the growth of our online presence, build our personal and agency brand, and turn our content into a client acquisition machine. You’ll work closely with our copywriters, media team, and CEO to plan, create, and publish compelling content across multiple platforms.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create high-converting content (reels, carousels, captions, short-form videos) using existing video footage, testimonials, and UGC

Repurpose long-form content (e.g. webinars, podcast, masterclasses) into short-form assets

Work with designers, editors, and writers to ensure quality output that aligns with our brand voice

Analyze performance data and iterate content based on insights and platform best practices



BRAND BUILDING & ENGAGEMENT

Grow and maintain a strong online presence for our CEO, COO and agency across all major platforms

Manage community engagement (responding to comments, DMs, and nurturing prospects)

Research trends, hooks, and viral formats to keep our content fresh and attention-grabbing

Create and maintain a swipe file of best-performing social content across industries



CAMPAIGN SUPPORT & LAUNCHES

Collaborate with our paid ads and funnel team to align organic content with launches and ongoing campaigns

Support
, ad, and launch strategies with complementary organic content

Track performance of content leading to conversions, leads, and webinar sign-ups

Brainstorm new content angles with the CEO and team for upcoming campaigns



REQUIREMENTS:

Strong command of English writing and storytelling (a must)

Proven experience managing social media for personal brands or agencies

A strong eye for design, layout, and visual storytelling (experience with Canva or Adobe tools is a plus)

Able to work independently and manage your own content calendar

Familiarity with marketing, sales psychology, and funnel strategy is preferred

Experience with Reels/TikTok editing, YouTube Shorts, or repurposing video content is a huge bonus

Obsessive about deadlines, details, and making things look damn good

Comfortable receiving feedback and iterating quickly



Bonus:

Experience working in the digital marketing, coaching, or SaaS space

Familiarity with GoHighLevel, Asana, Google Drive, or content scheduling tools





If you’re excited about building a social media machine that gets real business results and want to work with a high-performing, collaborative, and fun team — we’d love to hear from you.

Please complete the form below for consideration, and you will be notified once your application has been processed:

title: Full-Time Social Media & Content Manager (AI-Powered Content Operations)
description:
We're looking for a full-time Social Media & Content Manager who will own the end-to-end content pipeline across multiple brands and platforms. This is NOT a "schedule a few posts and call it a day" role. You will be the operational backbone of our content machine - managing AI-powered content creation workflows, repurposing existing content at scale, and ensuring a consistent stream of high-quality, targeted content goes out across every account, every day.



The majority of your work will center on project managing AI automations and content creation tools - not doing everything manually, but orchestrating the systems that produce, adapt, and distribute content efficiently.  You’ll be working alongside n8n workflows that will research, write and post content. We’re not expecting you to manage the workflows... your job will be to make sure the content is actually getting posted, responding to comments, managing DMs, etc. 



The Mission

Everything you do in this role serves exactly two objectives:

1. Grow the channels. Increase followers, reach, impressions, and audience size on every platform, every month. Period.

2. Drive conversions. Turn that audience into leads, booked calls, opt-ins, and revenue. Likes don't pay the bills.



Every post you schedule, every video you repurpose, every caption you write, every automation you manage - all of it must ladder up to one or both of these outcomes. We are not publishing content for the sake of publishing content. We are not chasing vanity metrics. We are not posting just to "stay active." If a piece of content doesn't serve growth or conversion, it doesn't go out.



You will be expected to think strategically about how each piece of content moves the needle. That means understanding the funnel, knowing what CTAs to use and when, and being able to connect content performance directly to business results. If your approach to social media is "post and pray," this is not the role for you. Start your proposal with the word "content ninja" so we know you read the full description.



What You'll Be Doing

-Platform Management: You will manage multiple accounts across the following platforms - each with its own ICP (Ideal Customer Profile), messaging, and content strategy:

-LinkedIn (personal brand + company pages)

-TikTok

-Instagram


 Personal Page


 Business Page(s)

-Content Repurposing & Creation: You'll take existing long-form content (videos, podcasts, articles, webinars, live streams) and repurpose it into platform-specific formats using AI tools including but not limited to:

ChatGPT, Claude, Perplexity, 

Pictory (video content repurposing)

CapCut (short-form video editing)

ChatGPT / Claude (copy generation, scripting, ideation)

Canva (graphics, carousels, stories)

Other AI content tools as we adopt them (and we adopt new tools regularly)

-AI Workflow & Automation Management: You'll manage and monitor automated content pipelines, ensuring outputs meet quality standards before publishing. This includes working with tools like n8n, GoHighLevel, and other automation platforms to keep content flowing.

-Content Calendar & Scheduling: Maintain and execute a content calendar across all platforms and accounts. Every account should have consistent, scheduled content with no gaps.

-ICP-Targeted Content: Each account targets a specific audience. You are responsible for ensuring that every piece of content is relevant, on-brand, and tailored to the ICP for that specific account. No generic, one-size-fits-all posting.

-Performance Tracking & Reporting: Monitor growth and conversion metrics across every account. Identify what's driving actual results - not just engagement, but follower growth, link clicks, opt-ins, and booked calls. You are expected to bring data-informed recommendations and pivot strategy when something isn't moving the needle.

-Community Engagement: Monitor comments, DMs, and mentions. Engage with the audience authentically and escalate conversations that require a personal touch.

-Trend Awareness: Stay current with platform algorithm changes, trending formats, viral content styles, and emerging AI tools that could improve our workflows.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

-Experience: Minimum 2 years of verifiable social media management experience. You must be able to provide examples of accounts you've managed, growth metrics you've achieved, and references from previous clients or employers. If you cannot verify your experience, do not apply.

-AI Tool Proficiency: You must be comfortable using AI-powered content creation and editing tools like ChatGPT, Claude, Pictory, CapCut, Canva, AI writing assistants, etc.

-Multi-Platform Expertise: Demonstrated experience managing content across LinkedIn, TikTok, Instagram, and
 simultaneously. You understand the nuances of each platform - what works on TikTok does NOT work on LinkedIn, and you know why.

-Project Management Skills: You'll be managing multiple content pipelines, automation workflows, and publishing schedules. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail are essential.

-Written Communication: Excellent English writing skills. You'll be crafting or refining copy daily using AI, but you’ll need to know what’s “good” and what isn’t.

-Availability: This is a full-time position - 8 hours per day, 5 days per week. You must be available during EASTERN US working hours and responsive on communication channels throughout the day.



Do NOT Apply If:

-You cannot dedicate 40 hours per week to this role. 

-You cannot provide verifiable proof of at least 2 years of social media management experience.

-You are looking for a part-time or casual gig.

-You are not comfortable learning and using new AI tools on a regular basis.

-You do not have reliable internet and a professional work setup.



Preferred (Bonus) Qualifications

-Experience with GoHighLevel, n8n, Zapier, or similar automation platforms

-Video editing skills beyond basic cuts (motion graphics, captions, transitions)

-Understanding of B2B content strategy, particularly for LinkedIn

-Experience working with personal brands or thought leadership content

-Familiarity with content strategy for service-based businesses or consultancies

-Analytics experience (Meta Business Suite, LinkedIn Analytics, TikTok Analytics)



How to Apply

In your proposal, include:

-One page resume or CV that outlines your social media management experience (accounts managed, platforms, duration)

-Links to at least 2 social media accounts you have managed (with permission to share)

-List any stats that you may have (“I grew this channel by 10,000 followers in 6 months”, etc)

-Which AI content creation tools you currently use and how you use them

-Your current client load and confirmation that you can commit to 40 hours/week

-Your timezone and typical working hours



Note: Generic proposals, AI create proposals and auto-bids will be immediately discarded and reported.

title: n8n Automation Specialist - Troubleshooting & Workflow Management
description:
We're looking for a skilled, reliable n8n specialist to join us long-term. This role is focused on maintaining, troubleshooting, and fixing existing n8n workflows on a self-hosted installation. If you're someone who can look at a broken workflow, diagnose the issue quickly, and get it running again, this is a good fit for you.



In most cases, you'll be working with pre-built workflows and templates that need to be installed, configured, and debugged. Some of these can be complex, with 20+ nodes across multiple integrations. You need to be comfortable navigating that complexity and resolving issues independently.



On occasion, you'll build new workflows from scratch, but the primary focus of this role is keeping our existing automation infrastructure healthy and running smoothly.



Core Responsibilities

-Diagnose and resolve issues in existing n8n workflows efficiently.

-Install and configure pre-built workflows and templates on a self-hosted n8n instance.

-Proactively monitor workflows and flag potential problems before they break.

-Document workflow configurations and provide clear status updates.

-Build simple to moderately complex new workflows as needed.

-Join Zoom calls to discuss project requirements and handle sensitive configurations (credentials, API keys, etc.).



What You Need:

-Proven, hands-on experience with n8n — specifically on self-hosted installations. This is non-negotiable.

-A strong troubleshooting mindset. You should be able to trace errors across nodes, read execution logs, and pinpoint failures without hand-holding.

-Solid understanding of API integrations, webhooks, and authentication flows.

-Working knowledge of Python for custom code nodes and debugging.

-Excellent communication skills in US English.

-Reliable internet connection and availability for Zoo
etings.

-Professional handling of sensitive data and credentials.



Ideal Candidate:

-You're not just someone who can follow a tutorial — you're someone who's already been in the weeds with n8n, fixed things that weren't working, and knows the platform's quirks. You take ownership, communicate clearly, and don't need to be told every step.



COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

-Base Pay: $500 - $1100 per month (paid bi-weekly or monthly)- it’s 40 hour work per week

-Growth Opportunity: Potential for pay increases and expanded responsibilities as you demonstrate results

-Flexible Schedule: Flexi sched as long as it’s Eastern US business hours



How to Apply

Please submit all of the following:

1. Your resume

2. A short summary of your n8n experience, max 5 sentences

title: Senior Risk & Compliance Consultant (Fintech & Crypto)
description:
We need an expert who bridges the gap between Web2 Traditional Finance (Fiat Rails) and Web3 On-chain Compliance.

Your core mission is not just to be a "blocker," but to "design safe mechanisms that enable business velocity." You will ensure we pass the rigorous onboarding requirements of our banking partners (e.g., Cybrid's AML program review) while managing the operational risks of a high-volume payment platform.



Key Responsibilities

Compliance Program Build-out

Draft BSA/AML Policies from Scratch: Create internal compliance policy documents (CIP, AML, OFAC) that meet US banking standards. This is a prerequisite for going live with partners like Cybrid.

Define KYC/KYB Standards: Design tiered identity verification workflows for our dual-track business (B2B Agency + B2C Palau ID). Define limits and requirements for Tier 1 vs. Tier 2 users.

Regulatory Strategy: Assess licensing requirements (MTL/MSB/MiCA) for US, Canada, and EU markets, providing a strategic roadmap for the next 12-24 months.

Operational Risk & Fraud Prevention

ACH Risk Management: specifically for ACH Pull scenarios. Design logic to mitigate NSF (Insufficient Funds) and Unauthorized Returns (e.g., balance checks via Plaid, settlement holding periods).

On-Chain Risk Integration: Configure on-chain analysis tools (e.g., GoPlus, Chainalysis, Elliptic) to define blocking rules for high-risk wallet addresses.

Transaction Monitoring: Set up velocity limits and alert rules for suspicious activities; handle Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) if necessary.

Partner Enablement

Due Diligence (DD): Represent the company in handling compliance inquiries from upstream banking partners and infrastructure providers (Cybrid, Hex Trust), assisting in completing complex DD questionnaires.

Vendor Assessment: Evaluate the compliance robustness of new payment rails (e.g., European SEPA, Asian local payouts).



Requirements

Experience: 5+ years of risk/compliance experience in Fintech or Crypto Exchanges. Must have hands-on experience with US Banking Rails (ACH/Wire).

Expertise:

Deep knowledge of FinCEN, OFAC sanctions, and AML workflows.

Strong understanding of the "FBO Account" model and the legal boundaries of a "Money Transmitter."

Understanding of stablecoin (USDC) minting and burning flows.

Tool Stack: Familiarity with industry-standard tools like Persona (Identity), Plaid (Bank Auth), and Chainalysis/TRM Labs (Crypto AML).

Mindset: Ability to balance "Compliance Requirements" with "User Experience." We don't need a bureaucrat; we need a builder who offers solutions.



Bonus Points

Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) certification.

Experience helping startups successfully onboard with Zero Hash, Cybrid, Circle, or Stripe.

Knowledge of RNS.ID (Palau Digital Residency) or similar sovereign identity projects.

Familiarity with India TDS tax regulations or Philippines cross-border remittance laws.

title: Compliance and Documentation Coordinator
description:
Overview

The Compliance and Documentation Coordinator is responsible for organizing, maintaining, and standardizing the company’s digital documentation across all departments. This role ensures that files, records, and reference materials are properly structured, easily accessible, and consistently updated — supporting smooth collaboration and operational efficiency across the organization.



Key Responsibilities

 Develop and maintain a centralized digital filing system for all departments (e.g., HR, Finance, Operations, Marketing).

 Ensure consistency in file naming, structure, and version control across shared drives and platforms.

 Regularly audit folders and files to remove duplicates, outdated content, and ensure accuracy.

 Coordinate with department heads to collect, organize, and update key documents, SOPs, and reports.

 Support documentation of workflows, processes, and company templates for operational use.

 Manage access permissions and data organization within platforms such as Google Drive, Notion, or SharePoint.

 Maintain logs and summaries of documentation updates and communicate changes to relevant teams.

 Provide guidance to tea
mbers on proper file management practices and document handling.



Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or related field (preferred but not required).

 Proven experience in digital file management, documentation, or operations coordination.

 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

 Familiarity with cloud storage platforms (e.g., Google Workspace, SharePoint, Dropbox).

 Excellent communication and coordination skills.

 Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks in a digital, fast-paced environment.



Preferred Skills

 Experience creating or maintaining SOPs and documentation templates. 

 Knowledge of data privacy and file access protocols.

 Basic understanding of project management or workflow tools



Success Indicators

 Company files are well-organized, easily searchable, and consistently formatted.

 Documentation updates are completed on time and communicated clearly.

 Teams can locate and use resources efficiently with minimal duplication or confusion.

title: Operations Manager – Medical Virtual Assistant Onboarding & Client Success Full-Time |Healthcare BPO Operation
description:
About Axis Bridge Medical:

We connect US medical practices with highly skilled, remote Medical Administrative Assistants and Medical Billing Specialists from the Philippines. As we rapidly scale, we need an experienced operations leader who can seamlessly onboard new clients, match them with the perfect VAs, oversee day-to-day VA performance, and ensure exceptional service delivery that keeps practices coming back. We have a list of potential assistants ready to work with clients and need a professional to sift through and pick the right candidates though interviews etc.



The Role:

We're seeking a seasoned BPO Operations Manager with proven onboarding expertise and hands-on experience supervising medical administrators and billers to serve as the operational backbone of our company. You'll be the trusted partner our US healthcare clients rely on from day one, taking prospects our sales team closes and transforming them into delighted, long-term clients through flawless execution.

This isn't just about paperwork. You'll build systems, develop people, monitor VA performance, reduce errors, solve problems, and create the operational excellence that sets us apart in the medical staffing industry.



What You'll Own:

Client Onboarding & Management:



Take ownership of every new client from contract signature to successful go-live

Conduct professional calls with practice managers and physicians

Gather detailed requirements: workflows, software systems, communication preferences, specific skills needed

Create customized onboarding plans with clear timelines and milestones

Manage all documentation: contracts, compliance forms, NDAs, HIPAA Business Associate Agreements (BAAs)

Serve as the primary point of contact during onboarding and beyond

Proactively monitor client satisfaction and address concerns before they escalate



VA Matching & Placement:



Assess client needs and match them with VAs who have the right medical background and skills

Review VA profiles, experience, certifications, and specialties (medical admin, billing, EHR systems, insurance verification, etc.)

Conduct thorough screening to ensure cultural fit and capability

Present qualified VA candidates to clients with detailed profiles



VA Performance Oversight & Quality Assurance:



Directly supervise and monitor Medical Administrative Assistants and Medical Billing Specialists in their daily work

Review work output for accuracy: patient scheduling, insurance verification, claim submissions, payment posting, denial management

Identify and reduce errors through systematic quality checks and corrective coaching

Improve efficiency by analysing workflows, identifying bottlenecks, and implementing best practices

Conduct regular performance evaluations and one-on-one meetings with VAs

Track KPIs: claim acceptance rates, denial rates, scheduling accuracy, response times, patient satisfaction

Handle escalations from clients regarding VA performance issues

Implement performance improvement plans when standards aren't met

Recognize and reward top performers to maintain motivation and quality



Training & Development:



Develop client-specific training plans for VAs based on practice requirements

Ensure VAs understand HIPAA compliance, patient privacy, and healthcare regulations

Train VAs on client-specific EHR systems (Epic, Cerner, Athenahealth, etc.), workflows, and protocols

Create ongoing training programs to upskill VAs on medical billing codes (CPT, ICD-10), insurance policies, and administrative procedures

Monitor VA performance during initial weeks and provide intensive coaching

Conduct regular refresher training to maintain quality standards

Mentor VAs on professional communication with US healthcare staff and patients



Process Development & Optimization:



Build and document standardized onboarding processes and playbooks

Create templates: onboarding checklists, training materials, client handbooks, SOP documents, quality assurance checklists

Develop error-tracking systems to identify patterns and prevent recurring mistakes

Implement CRM systems and tracking tools to manage client pipelines and VA performance metrics

Create efficiency benchmarks for common tasks (claims processing time, scheduling accuracy, etc.)

Identify bottlenecks and continuously improve operational efficiency

Develop metrics and KPIs to measure onboarding success, client satisfaction, and VA productivity

Build quality assurance processes that catch errors before they reach clients



Team Leadership (as we grow):



Eventually recruit, train, and supervise additional onboarding coordinators and team leads

Build a high-performing operations team that can scale with company growth

Foster a culture of excellence, accountability, continuous improvement, and client-first mindset

Develop career paths and advancement opportunities for top-performing VAs





Success in This Role Looks Like:

Week 1-2: Every new client has a structured onboarding plan and knows exactly what to expect

30 Days: Clients are live with their VAs, confident in the quality, and providing positive feedback

60 Days: You've documented repeatable processes, established quality checkpoints, and are actively monitoring VA performance to reduce errors

90 Days: Client retention is high, VAs are performing well with measurable accuracy improvements, and you're proactively solving problems before they become issues

6 Months: You've built systems that allow us to onboard 10+ clients monthly with consistent excellence, error rates are trending down, and efficiency metrics are improving across all VAs



Required Qualifications:

MUST HAVE - Non-Negotiable:



5-10+ years BPO operations experience – You've managed offshore teams, client accounts, and service delivery in a virtual environment

Proven Operations Manager background – You've led teams, managed multiple clients simultaneously, and consistently hit performance targets

Direct experience supervising medical administrators and/or medical billing specialists – You've monitored their work, identified errors, coached for improvement, and driven quality metrics

Quality assurance and error reduction expertise – You know how to implement QA processes, track accuracy metrics, and systematically improve performance

Efficiency optimization experience – You've analysed workflows, identified inefficiencies, and implemented solutions that improved productivity and turnaround times

Client onboarding expertise – You've successfully onboarded 20+ clients and know how to create seamless transitions that build trust

HIPAA knowledge and healthcare compliance – You understand patient privacy, PHI handling, Business Associate Agreements, and healthcare regulations (or have worked in medical BPO)

Medical billing and/or administrative operations knowledge – You understand the work your VAs do: insurance verification, claim submission, denial management, scheduling, patient communication, etc.

Process builder mentality – You don't just execute, you create systems, document workflows, and leave things better than you found them

Exceptional communication skills – You can professionally interact with US physicians, practice managers, and administrative staff

CRM and project management tools proficiency – Experience with Google Workspace, CRMs, Asana, 
, or similar platforms

Problem solver and decision maker – You don't wait for answers; you assess situations and take appropriate action

Fluent English (written and spoken) – You represent our company to US clients daily



Bonus Points:



Experience managing medical billing teams with measurable improvements in claim acceptance rates

Familiarity with US medical EHR systems (Epic, Cerner, Athenahealth, eClinicalWorks)

Knowledge of CPT, ICD-10 coding, and insurance payer requirements

Experience training teams on HIPAA and compliance protocols

Background implementing quality assurance dashboards and performance tracking systems

Track record of 95%+ client satisfaction ratings and quantifiable error reduction (e.g., "reduced claim denials by 30%")





Why This Role is Critical:

Our sales team is bringing in clients. But sales mean nothing if onboarding fails or VA performance is inconsistent. You are the person who:



Turns a signed contract into a thriving client relationship

Ensures our VAs are set up for success from day one

Catches errors before they reach clients and damage our reputation

Continuously improves efficiency so our VAs deliver more value

Builds the trust and credibility that leads to referrals and long-term retention

Creates the operational foundation for our company to scale to 50, 100, 200+ clients



You're not just an operations manager. You're the reason clients stay and the reason our VAs excel.



What We're Looking For (The Intangibles):

This role is NOT for you if:



You need hand-holding or constant direction

You prefer to "just follow orders" rather than build systems

You avoid difficult conversations, client escalations, or performance management

You've never managed multiple competing priorities simultaneously

You're uncomfortable holding people accountable for quality and accuracy



This role IS for you if:



You've been the "go-to person" who makes things happen in every job you've had

You have a track record of reducing errors and improving team efficiency through systematic oversight

Clients feel they trust you more than anyone else they work with

You take pride in operational excellence, quality assurance, and client satisfaction

You're energized by building something from the ground up

You want ownership, autonomy, and the chance to shape a growing company

You know how to balance being supportive with holding high standards





Benefits:

Performance Bonuses: Quarterly bonuses tied to client retention, satisfaction metrics, error reduction, and efficiency improvements

Growth Opportunity: As we scale, this role evolves into VP of Operations with team-building responsibilities and equity potential

Work Schedule: Full-time, remote, with some overlap with US business hours (flexible within reason)



To Apply, Submit:



Your BPO operations background – Companies you've worked with, size of teams managed, clients handled, industries served

Your VA supervision experience – How many medical administrators/billers have you overseen? What were your quality metrics? How did you reduce errors and improve efficiency? (Be specific with numbers/results)

Your onboarding track record – How many clients have you onboarded? What was your process? What were your satisfaction ratings?

Your HIPAA/healthcare experience – Describe your knowledge of healthcare compliance, medical terminology, or medical BPO work

Your first 90-day plan – If hired, what would you build/implement in your first 3 months to ensure operational excellence, quality assurance, and VA performance optimization?

Why you're the right fit – What makes you different from other operations managers? What's your superpower?



Include the word "OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE" in your subject line so we know you read this thoroughly.



What Happens Next:



Phase 1: We'll review applications and contact qualified candidates within 3-5 business days

Phase 2: Initial interview to discuss your background, approach to quality assurance, and VA supervision 

Phase 3: Scenario-based interview (we'll give you real client situations and VA performance issues to walk through)

Phase 4: Reference checks with emphasis on quality metrics and team management

Phase 5: Offer for the right candidate

title: Technical SEO & On-Page Optimization Specialist (Wix Studio | Large Content Site)

Monitor “Crawled – currently not indexed” pages

Work inside Wix Studio CMS

Document changes made

Indexation

Canonicals

Schema markup

Internal linking strategy

title: Content Strategist + Designer + Editor
description:

The Role

 • Plan monthly content strategy

 • Design high-converting carousels

 • Edit high-quality reels

 • Create branded graphics

 • Help manage content calendar

 • Turn ideas into polished, strategic assets



You will help position us as the authority in functional fertility.





Responsibilities



Strategy & Planning

Design & Creative

Copy & Messaging

Organization

 • Track performance insights





Who You Are

 • Experienced in Instagram content strategy for high-ticket brands (maybe also LinkedIn optimization)

 • Understand storytelling + conversion psychology

 • Can edit reels to feel elevated and professional, not “influencer-y”

 • Proactive with ideas (not waiting to be told every detail)

 • Comfortable working with sensitive health topics

 • Highly organized

 • Fast turnaround



Bonus:

KPIs (Success Looks Like)

Compensation
