title: High-Volume Performance DM Setter (Credit Repair)
description:
PROVEN ELITE DM / APPOINTMENT SETTER (CREDIT REPAIR ONLY)



READ BEFORE APPLYING — NO EXCEPTIONS



This is NOT a beginner role.

This is NOT for someone with zero experience.



We WILL train you on our systems, scripts, and processes — but we are ONLY looking for someone who already has experience as a DM / Appointment Setter.



We are hiring ONE proven DM / Appointment Setter with a verifiable track record in CREDIT REPAIR.



If you have not booked calls for a credit repair company before, do not apply.



ROLE OBJECTIVE (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

Book QUALIFIED credit repair strategy calls on my calendar DAILY.



Not leads.

Not conversations.

Booked calls with serious, credit-ready prospects.



LEAD FLOW & DM PROCESS

• Many prospects will comment the keyword: “CREDIT”

• An AUTOMATED message is sent immediately

• Based on the prospect’s response, YOU take over the conversation

• Some prospects will NOT comment the keyword

• You are still required to follow up with ALL interested prospects

• NO LEADS ARE LOST until the prospect is clearly NOT eligible or disqualified

• Your job is to qualify, follow up, and convert prospects into booked calls



DAILY RESPONSIBILITIES

• Send 50–100+ outbound DMs per day

• Respond to ALL inbound messages (keyword and non-keyword)

• Take over conversations after automation triggers

• Proactively follow up with interested prospects who did not comment the keyword

• Qualify prospects (credit situation, urgency, goals)

• Follow up until they book or are disqualified

• Book calls directly to my calendar with expectations set

• Reduce no-shows through confirmations and follow-ups



No waiting.

No missed follow-ups.

No hand-holding.



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (MANDATORY)

• Proven DM / appointment setting experience in CREDIT REPAIR

• Ability to SHOW PROOF of results (screenshots, calendars, KPIs)

• Strong written English (sales-level)

• Confidence handling objections and creating urgency

• Ability to work independently and hit daily numbers



No beginners.

No trainees.

No “willing to learn.”



PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS

• 50–100+ outbound DMs per day

• Consistent quality calls booked daily

• Clean follow-up system

• High accountability

• No lead left unworked unless disqualified



Failure to perform will result in termination.



PAY, TIERS & BONUSES

• Base pay with TIERED PAY LEVELS based on performance

• Pay increases as booking volume, quality, and consistency increase

• BONUS OPPORTUNITIES based on performance and closed deals

• Long-term opportunity for top performers only



AVAILABILITY

• Must work during U.S. business hours

• Reliable internet REQUIRED

• Daily consistency REQUIRED



HOW TO APPLY (STRICT)

Start your application with: “I BOOK CREDIT REPAIR CALLS”



Include:

• Your credit repair DM setting experience

• Average calls booked per week

• PROOF of past results



No proof = no response.



FINAL NOTICE

This role is for proven credit repair setters only.

If you can book quality calls every day, apply now.

If not — do not apply.

title: Senior Affiliate & Influencer Marketing Manager 5 years experience
description:
About Legend Sports & Razzaque

At Legend Sports, we’re building a powerhouse in the sports and active lifestyle market. We believe in the power of creators, affiliates, and influencers to connect with audiences authentically—and we’re looking for a top-tier performer to take our affiliate and UGC marketing systems to the next level.

At Razzaque Paradise Properties we are developing High End Residences in Kuta Lombok where we looking for UGC and affiliates.



The Role

We’re seeking a Senior Affiliate & Influencer Marketing Manager who thrives in fast-moving e-commerce and sports/lifestyle industries en Real Estate. The ideal candidate will design and manage scalable systems for affiliate partnerships, influencer collaborations, and UGC campaigns, with a laser focus on traction, conversions, and ROI. You shouldn have at least 4 years experience in this job role, if you dont do not respond!



This is not a “plug-and-play” role—we’re looking for a strategic builder who can identify gaps, implement solutions, and execute campaigns that directly drive sales growth and brand presence.



Key Responsibilities

• Develop and scale affiliate & UGC pipelines that are sustainable and performance-driven

• Manage outreach to hundreds of potential creators weekly, securing high-quality partnerships

• Onboard and nurture affiliates to ensure ongoing alignment and results

• Oversee content creation, approvals, and feedback loops to maintain brand quality and consistency

• Troubleshoot common pain points, such as:

• Ghosted or inactive creators

• Delayed product delivery and fulfillment issues

• Low-performing or misaligned content



Tools & Platforms You’ll Work With

• Affiliate management platforms (e.g., Levanta, Social Snowball, etc.)

• Creator marketplaces and influencer platforms (e.g., TikTok Creator Marketplace, Amazon Affiliates)

• E-commerce platforms (e.g., Shopify)

• Performance tracking and analytics tools



What We’re Looking For

• Proven experience running affiliate, influencer, and UGC campaigns in e-commerce (sports or lifestyle industry a plus)

• Ability to manage 100+ creator relationships while maintaining brand quality

• Strong operational mindset—able to systemize processes and scale campaigns efficiently

• Self-starter with excellent communication and relationship-building skills

• Results-oriented, with a track record of delivering measurable growth



What Success Looks Like

• Building a high-converting affiliate & UGC system that delivers consistent traction

• Driving weekly onboarding of new affiliates and creators

• Successfully scaling campaigns without sacrificing quality

• Directly contributing to sales growth, visibility, and brand presence



Why Join Legend Sports?

At Legend Sports, you’ll have the opportunity to lead influencer and affiliate marketing at scale, working with a brand that’s ready for growth. We’re looking for someone who’s not just managing campaigns—but building systems that last.



If you’re ready to deliver traction, systems, and conversions through creators and affiliates, we’d love to hear from you. Leave a response with BloodyUGC

title: Sales Closer
description:
How to Apply

* Send your most updated resume to 



About us:



Gushwork.ai builds AI Agents that help small and medium businesses automate their entire inbound marketing stack — from SEO and website content to reviews, blogs, and lead funnels. Our current focus is the manufacturing and industrial distributors industry.



In plain English: we’re replacing bloated marketing agencies with intelligent, always-on software.



Backed by Lightspeed, SIG, Beenext, and B Capital, Gushwork.ai is one of the fastest-growing AI companies globally.



In just a year, we’ve grown to $1.5M ARR and are scaling fast toward $15M ARR in the next 12 months — helping thousands of small businesses grow smarter, not harder.



The Role:



We’re looking for a closer who thrives in fast-paced, high-velocity sales environments. You’ll own the full sales cycle from discovery to close for qualified meetings booked by our 10-person BDR team. This is a quota-carrying role where you’ll close 4-8 deals monthly, with deal cycles ranging from 1-3 calls.



Working Hours: US Shift (9:00 AM - 6:00 PM EST)

Work Mode: Remote



What You’ll Do:



- Run discovery calls with qualified prospects (OEMs, distributors, manufacturers) to uncover pain points around lead generation and digital presence

- Deliver compelling demos that connect our AI SEO solution to specific business outcomes and revenue impact

- Navigate buying committees within SMB organizations, typically engaging with Marketing Directors, Sales Leaders, and C-suite

- Close deals on 12-month contracts with ACV of $5k-$25k, meeting or exceeding monthly quota

- Manage pipeline with discipline—forecast accurately, maintain detailed CRM hygiene, and move deals forward with urgency

- Partner with Growth Managers post-sale to ensure smooth handoffs and identify expansion opportunities

- Iterate on sales methodology by sharing wins/losses and collaborating on improving conversion rates



What Success Looks Like:



- Month 1-2: Ramp on product, market, and sales process; close your first 2-3 deals

- Month 3+: Consistently hit/exceed quota of 4-8 closed deals monthly

- Ongoing: Maintain 30%+ demo-to-close conversion rate and sub-30 day sales cycles



You’re a Great Fit If You Have:



- 2-4 years of closing experience in B2B SaaS, MarTech, or digital services

- Proven track record hitting/exceeding quota in a high-velocity sales environment

- SMB sales chops—you know how to build urgency, handle objections, and close without lengthy procurement cycles

- Consultative selling skills—you diagnose before prescribing and can articulate ROI clearly

- Comfort with ambiguity—you’re joining an early-stage startup where adaptability matters

- CRM proficiency (Zoho, HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.) and strong process discipline

- Excellent English communication skills for engaging with global prospects

- Want to hustle like crazy to hit the numbers!



Bonus Points For:



- Experience selling to manufacturers, distributors, or industrial/B2B companies

- Background in SEO, content marketing, or lead generation solutions

- Track record in 1-3 call close environments

- Familiarity with AI-powered products

- Experience selling to US/international markets



What We Offer:



- Accelerators for over-quota performance—top performers earn significantly more

- Qualified pipeline delivered daily by our BDR team—focus on closing, not prospecting

- Fast feedback loops—short sales cycles mean you learn and earn quickly

- Career growth—as we scale, top performers move into senior AE or team lead roles

- Equity in a VC-backed rocketship

- Collaborative, high-performance culture where wins are celebrated and losses are learning 
nts

- Remote work



Our Sales Process



- BDR books qualified meeting ? hands off to you

- Call 1: Discovery (30-45 min) - understand business, pain points, buying process

- Call 2: Demo + Proposal (45-60 min) - tailored walkthrough, ROI discussion, pricing

- Call 3 (if needed): Negotiation/Close - handle final objections, terms, signatures

- Handoff to Growth Manager for onboarding



How to Apply

* Send your most updated resume to

title: Capital Manager
description:
We’re HIRING a Capital Manager



To apply, please complete this application form: 

Only submissions through this form will be considered.



We’re looking for a high-energy, results-driven Capital Manager to lead Moe’s Group’s external capital strategy. In this role, you will identify, negotiate, and secure funding through loans, private investors, and strategic financial partnerships. Your success will directly fuel our expansion through consistent capital injections and strong, long-term investor relationships.



About Us:

Moe’s Group is a global leader in skincare manufacturing, trusted by over 100 international brands. We combine innovation, quality, and a personalized approach to help businesses scale and succeed in competitive markets. From manufacturing to brand strategy, our end-to-end services are designed to exceed expectations, backed by a team committed to customer satisfaction and long-term success. At Moe’s Group, we don’t just support brands—we empower them to lead.



What you’ll do:



-Lead fundraising and capital acquisition efforts, securing funding through traditional bank loans, private equity, venture capital, and alternative financing sources

-Build, expand, and manage relationships with lenders, banks, private investors, and strategic financial partners

-Serve as the primary point of contact for all external funding sources

-Structure and negotiate loan and investment terms that protect company interests and maximize long-term value

-Identify opportunities to generate consistent weekly or monthly income through strategic capital placements or investment vehicles

-Monitor lending and investment markets to secure competitive rates, favorable terms, and high-value partnerships

-Create and deliver compelling investor pitches and presentations that clearly communicate Moe’s Group’s growth strategy and financial strength



What we’re looking for:



-3–5 years of experience in capital raising, investment banking, corporate finance, or a related field

-Proven track record of successfully securing funding or closing financial deals

-Strong existing network of lenders, banks, or private investors is highly preferred

-Resilience and persistence in navigating the high-rejection nature of fundraising

-Strong financial acumen and ability to simplify complex business models for investors

-Advanced negotiation skills with experience reviewing and structuring financial agreements



Why join us?



-High-impact role directly influencing company growth

-Opportunity to build and lead external capital strategy

-Long-term position with strong growth potential

-Collaborative leadership team and entrepreneurial environment

-Competitive compensation aligned with performance



Learn more about our company by visiting our website:

title: Ecom Performance Graphic Designer (Static Ads) | High-Growth | Long-Term
description:
The purpose of the Graphic Designer role at Ivy Ecommerce is to transform creative briefs into high-performing static ads that drive conversions at scale.



This is not just a design role.



Our Graphic Designers are an integral part of the marketing engine. Your job is to understand the psychology, messaging, and strategy behind each ad concept — and bring it to life through strong visual hierarchy, compelling layouts, persuasive copy placement, and attention to detail.



As a Performance Graphic Designer, you are responsible for the execution and final polish of our static ad creatives across platforms like
, Instagram, and TikTok.



The success of our marketing team depends on your ability to:



- Understand each creative brief from a performance/direct-response marketing lens

- Design static ad creatives that grab attention and drive clicks

- Structure layouts, headlines, offers, and call-to-actions for maximum conversion impact

- Enhance the core marketing message through smart visual decisions



You understand that small details — spacing, typography, contrast, hook placement — can be the difference between an ad that scales to millions in spend and one that fails during testing.



Your role is to work closely with our Creative Strategists, actively learn what makes ads win or lose, and help us consistently produce winning creatives month over month across our brand portfolio.





Primary Responsibilities



- Design and deliver ~5 static ad briefs per week

- Collaborate closely with Creative Strategists to ensure each concept is executed accurately

- Implement feedback from the creative team and performance data to improve iterations

- Learn and internalize our ad strategy frameworks to understand what makes creatives “win” or “lose”

- Analyze your own designs to identify what’s working and what isn’t

- Prepare and export final assets in correct sizes and formats for each advertising platform

- Organize design files and assets properly for team workflow





Qualifications

Direct Experience

- 1+ year experience designing eCommerce / performance marketing static ads

- Strong portfolio showcasing direct-response or conversion-focused creatives

- Experience working within a team and understanding creative workflows

- Proficiency in tools such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Figma, or Canva (advanced level)





Character Traits We Look For



- Extremely high attention to detail — you care about alignment, spacing, readability, and polish

- Creative + marketing-minded — you’re not just a designer, you care about performance

- Strong understanding of visual hierarchy and direct-response principles

- Curious about why certain ads perform better than others

- Coachable and open to feedback

- Clear communicator who collaborates well with a team

- Time-efficient but willing to put in extra effort when quality demands it

- Growth-oriented — you want to improve your marketing and creative skills

- To make sure you are still reading, type “BLUE” in your response title.

- Not a clock-in, clock-out mindset — you care about results and impact





This Role Is NOT for You If:



- You only want to make “pretty” designs without caring about conversions

- You’re not interested in learning performance marketing or ad psychology

- You dislike feedback or fast-paced environments

- You’re disorganized or unreliable

- You prefer working solo and don’t enjoy collaboration

- You’re not motivated to grow your skills long-term





Growth & Upside



At Ivy Ecommerce, we invest in people who perform and show initiative. This role has real upside for those who take ownership:



- Opportunity to grow into a Senior Designer / Creative Strategist role

- Increased responsibility across multiple brands in our portfolio

- Performance-based bonuses tied to ad performance (no cap)

- Long-term growth path into higher-level marketing and creative leadership roles



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to build a career in performance marketing and creative strategy — not just design static graphics.





???? How to Apply



To be considered, please reply with:



- A short overview of yourself

- Your CV / Resume with past work experience

- Your eCommerce static ad portfolio (conversion-focused work preferred)

- Your
 address + WhatsApp number





Then answer the questions below in detail:



1. What about this role excites you most?

2. Why do you believe you’re a strong fit for this role?



Applications that do not follow these instructions or provide detailed answers will not be reviewed.

title: SENIOR FB ADS + Google ADS specialist 6+ Years experience

About the Companies

Razzaque Paradise Properties are growth-driven companies operating in competitive real estate markets. We are focused on lead generation and acquisition, not vanity metrics. Our goal is simple: consistent, high-quality real estate leads that convert into deals.



We are looking for a top-tier Paid Ads Specialist with deep, hands-on experience in real estate
 Ads and Google Ads to take ownership of our acquisition funnel.



The Role

We are hiring an experienced Real Estate
 & Google Ads Specialist with at least 5 years of proven experience running paid acquisition campaigns in real estate.



This role is for someone who understands real estate buyer and seller psychology, knows how to build funnels that convert, and can optimize campaigns for cost per lead, cost per acquisition, and deal quality.



This is not an entry-level role. We want a strategic operator, not just an ad launcher.



Key Responsibilities

• Plan, launch, and scale
 Ads and Google Ads for real estate acquisition

• Build and optimize full-funnel campaigns (cold traffic ? retargeting ? conversion)

• Generate qualified buyer and seller leads, not junk traffic

• Continuously optimize for CPL, CPA, ROAS, and lead quality

• Write and test high-converting ad creatives, copy, and audiences

• Set up and manage tracking (Meta Pixel, Google Tags, conversions, events)

• Analyze performance data and make data-driven decisions

• Identify and fix funnel bottlenecks quickly

• Collaborate with internal teams to improve lead follow-up and conversion



What We’re Looking For

• Minimum 6 years of hands-on experience running
 & Google Ads for real estate

• Proven track record in real estate lead generation and acquisition

• Strong understanding of buyer/seller funnels and local market targeting

• Experience with high-spend accounts and scaling winning campaigns

• Ability to manage budgets responsibly and profitably

• Highly analytical, results-driven, and detail-oriented

• Self-starter who takes ownership and accountability



What Success Looks Like

• Consistent flow of high-quality real estate leads

• Stable and scalable acquisition systems

• Improved CPL and CPA over time

• Clear reporting and transparency on performance

• Direct contribution to closed deals and revenue growth



Why Work With Us

• Serious brands with real budgets and clear acquisition goals

• Long-term opportunity for the right performer

• Full ownership of the paid ads channel

• Results-focused environment (no micromanagement, no fluff)



If you are a real estate paid ads expert who knows how to drive acquisition—not just clicks—we want to hear from you.

title: Job Title: Elite Sales Closer – US Tariff Refunds (Warm Leads, $4K+ Deals, No Cold Calling)
description:
Job Title: Elite Sales Closer – US Tariff Refunds ($4K+ Deals, Warm Calls Only)

Salary: $500–$1,500/month (base + commissions = $3K–$8K/mo for closers)

Hours: Mon-Fri, 8:00 AM - 1:00 PM Pacific Time (11 PM - 4 AM PH time, 5 hrs/day)



About Us:

US trade compliance firm recovering $millions from unconstitutional tariffs for importers nationwide. Fast-growing—need 1 proven closer NOW for warm US exec calls.



Your Day:



4-6 scheduled calls/day with pre-qualified leads (they replied "interested").



Script: Show refund math, pitch services, close. Send contract/payment. Follow up maybes. Update sheet + daily report.



NO cold calls, NO lead gen, NO paperwork.

25% upfront audit fees ($1K on $4K close).



10% first 6 months' retainers ($300/mo per $3K client).



5% recovery bonus.



$500 bonus for first 5 closes in 30 days.

 avg = $500 base + $8K commissions = $8.5K total. Closers hit $5K+/mo by Month 3.

title: Senior Video Editor *Superstar Only*
description:
We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

- Reconcile transactions across multiple payment platforms, including Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRM tools

- Manage accounts payable, ensuring all invoices are properly reviewed, recorded, and scheduled for payment

title: Guest Support Specialist
description:
We are looking for a Guest Experience Specialist to join our team and ensure our guests enjoy a seamless and memorable stay. This role requires strong communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple tasks across guest support, property operations, and vendor coordination.



Responsibilities



Guest Communication & Support

•  Answer questions from current, incoming, and inquiring guests using our property information sheet

•  Process vendor payments

•  Handle ad-hoc data entry projects



Results Expected

Requirements



•  Prior experience in guest support with Airbnb

•  Excellent written and spoken English

•  Extreme attention to detail and outstanding customer service skills

•  Fast and accurate typing skills

•  Strong problem-solving ability

•  Willingness to work weekends and night shifts

•  Ability to work with multiple platforms: Google Drive, Google Docs, Google Sheets, 
, WhatsApp

title: Property Management Bookkeeper
description:
Role Overview



We are actively hiring experienced Trust Accounting Specialists with hands-on AppFolio or Rentvine experience to join our U.S. property management accounting team.



This is a full-time, long-term remote role supporting property management companies with daily trust accounting, bank reconciliations, and financial operations.

Important: Only apply if you have real AppFolio or Rentvine experience and can demonstrate strong written communication skills.



Ideal Start Date: Immediately

Hours of Work: Hourly, 40 hours/week

Compensation: $10 - $11.75/hr

Status: Full-time position

Location: Remote



WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR

We are looking for A-players, ready to jump into a thriving, entrepreneurially-driven company that has become the leader in our industry. We value people who are honest, coachable, invested, and willing to give their best to their clients and team. We appreciate growth mindsets, courage, candor, gratitude, and the entrepreneurial spirit that define our fully remote team of professionals. We seek new tea
mbers who are all in for the next steps of company growth!



Mission of the Role

The objective of this position is to deliver the great experience (owning the outcome, ease of doing business, and extraordinary service) to our clients through quality assurance reviews, client relationship and account management that delivers accurate, timely, and efficient full-service accounting, while also maintaining an awareness of the unique needs and profit-growing/stewardship opportunities of each individual client.

Job Purpose



The Trust Accounting Specialist is responsible for managing the day-to-day trust accounting processes for property management companies with Trust Accounts. In addition to Trust Accounting expertise, this role requires strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively support client interactions, internal collaboration, and process documentation.



Job Duties and Responsibilities:



Ownership of functions

-Communication

-Inbox management 

-Weekly update
 to client

-Evaluate and implement routine client communication as needed, even if not on the original instructions

-Notify the AE of client dissatisfaction, unmet deadlines, higher-level issues



Accounting requests to include: 

-Vendor credits

-Transferring funds

-General receipts & deposits

-Tenant charges

-Tenant deposits

-Tenant credits

-Owner adjustments

-Ownership changes

-Owner cancellations

-To include transferring deposits to new ownership/management

-To include Lease Only payouts

-HAP payments

-Late fees, eviction notices, NSF processing

-Security deposits

-Both the basic AppFolio flow, and any unique client constraints or policies



A/P cycle

-Approve bills (if the VA enters the bills)

-Management fee posting & payout

-Vendor payments (with any unique client constraints)

-Send physical check files to client

-Issue or request stop payments as directed



Owner accounting

-Owner statement review & sending

-Owner disbursements

-Banking

-Bank deposit followup

-Bank reconciliation troubleshooting & review

-Initiating bank transfers

-With AE approval, enter corrective JEs

-Review issued checks past 90 days



Other projects

-Negative & positive FDR review

-Assist with 1099s and other AE-assigned projects as requested

-Ad hoc reporting (with established process)

-Review management fees for new move-ins

-Review fee settings on vacant properties

-Manage recurring JEs/recurring bills



Administrative expectations:

-Participate in setting and meeting SMART goals on a monthly and quarterly basis

-Attend weekly company meetings 

-Participate in company initiatives 



Required Qualifications: 

-Background in Accounting or proven understanding of basic accounting principles

-Experience with Appfolio 

-Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets

-Good command of written communication

-Excellent problem-solving skills

-Detail-oriented

-Able to understand new concepts with written and hands-on support



Preferred Qualifications:

-Experience in Google Suite products 

-Understanding of property management accounting

-AppFolio 

-Rentvine 



Working Conditions:

-The job of Trust Accounting Specialist is performed in a work-from-home environment

-Expectation of set working hours of overlap with Mountain, Central, or Eastern Standard Time 

-Virtual communication is routine, so must have reliable internet connection and use of a webcam



To apply, please submit your application through the link below:

About Oswego Financial



Oswego Financial is a growth-focused life insurance and financial services agency specializing in life insurance, indexed universal life (IUL), fixed annuities, and retirement planning strategies. We operate in a compliance-driven environment and prioritize structured systems, client experience, and scalable growth.

Set up agent hierarchy and permissions

Workflows and Automations

Lead intake automation 
, Instagram, landing pages, inbound calls)

AI-powered SMS and
 follow-up assistants

 and Instagram lead form integration

Campaign tracking dashboards



Call Systems and Tracking

Required Qualifications

 Ads Manager, Google Ads, calendar systems, and Twilio or similar VoIP

title: Airbnb STR Virtual Assistant Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced Virtual Assistant Manager to join and support our fast-growing short-term rental management company. This role is not only operational but also supervisory, as we currently have a team of 3 VAs. The ideal candidate will take ownership of overseeing the current VA team, assisting them when needed, and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.



This is a full-time position requiring a 50-hour workweek - 10 hours per day, 5 days per week (Thu-Mon), 11am-9pm PT, but you are required to stand by between 9-11pm in case of urgent cases. The role requires availability for evening, night, and weekend work as operational needs dictate. All tasks must be completed personally. Delegating work to sub-VAs is strictly prohibited.



Team Management

- Supervise, support, and mentor a growing team of 3 Virtual Assistants handling guest communication and daily operations.

- Monitor team performance and ensure standards are met (response rate, resolution quality, guest satisfaction, task completion, etc).

- Conduct regular check-ins, performance reviews, and lead weekly tea
etings.

- Provide coaching, feedback, coverage, 1 on 1 meetings, and ongoing training.



Operational Oversight

- Oversee daily guest communication workflows, ensuring timely and high-quality responses.

- Manage escalation issues and support VAs with complex guest situations.

- Assist with administrative tasks such as but not limited to relistings, updating listings, outreaching for vendors (handyman, cleaners, lawn maintenance, etc), and other tasks.

- Coordinate with maintenance, cleaning, and other vendors as needed.

- Ensure SOPs are followed and updated as needed.

- Conduct daily reports for skip managers.

- Maintain high guest satisfaction and consistency in service delivery.



Operational & Performance Improvements

- Optimize account settings, including PMS workflows, OTA configurations, and third-party integrations.

- Monitor account health, listing performance, and revenue to identify issues and improvement opportunities.

- Track guest messages, reviews, tickets, and tasks to ensure timely follow-up.

- Identify recurring problems and implement process improvements.

- Lead expansion efforts for new OTAs and direct-booking channels.



Scheduling & Resource Management

- Manage VA work schedules to ensure coverage across time zones and peak periods.

- Track attendance, productivity, and workload distribution.

- Assist with onboarding and training of new VAs as the team grows.



Qualifications

- Proven experience with Airbnb, VRBO, Bookings, or other short-term rental platforms.

- Prior experience managing or supervising a VA team is strongly preferred.

- Familiarity with Hostaway and Pricelabs property management software is required.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

- Strong organizational skills with great attention to detail.

- Ability to problem-solve and handle multiple tasks under pressure.

- Proactive, self-motivated, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.

- Experience working across different time zones is a plus.

- You will be working in US Pacific timezone.



Please make sure you complete all the questions in this form along with your application. We will ONLY consider applicants who complete all the questions.

title: Short-Form Video Editor Remote | Part-Time / Full-Time | Long-Term Partnership
description:
About the Role

We're looking for a talented short-form video editor who doesn't just follow a brief — you get it. You understand what makes people stop scrolling, what keeps them watching, and what drives them to engage. This isn't a one-off gig. We want to build a real, long-term creative partnership with the right person.

What You'll Do



Edit short-form videos for Instagram (Reels, Stories) — and occasionally other platforms

Craft scroll-stopping hooks that capture attention in the first 1–2 seconds

Source and layer in b-roll, sound effects, trending audio, captions, and motion graphics

Deliver both clean, simple edits and more advanced, dynamic cuts depending on the content

Turn around edits quickly with strong communication and fast response times

Proactively suggest creative ideas, trends, and improvements — not just wait for instructions



Who You Are



You know Instagram inside and out — what performs, what's trending, and why certain videos go viral

You understand that the hook is the most important part of any short-form video

You have your own creative taste and editorial eye — you don't just execute, you elevate

You know where to find quality b-roll, sound effects, and music that fit the vibe

You can follow a creative brief precisely, but you also know when to push it further

You're reliable, responsive, and easy to communicate with

You're hungry to grow and build something together over the long term



Preferred Tools

CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, DaVinci Resolve, or similar. We're flexible on software — what matters is the quality of the output.

How to Apply

To apply, please send us:



A short introduction about yourself and your editing experience

Links to 2–3 examples of short-form videos you've edited (Instagram Reels preferred)

Your availability



Also let me know if you are able to do a test edit

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Executive Assistant

Fully Remote, Part-Time



ABOUT YOU

You have a refining nature that is always looking for how to make things a little bit better. You notice the small things like a repeating conversation, a habit people fall into, or an unnoticed shortcut. You adapt or suggest changes to others, so those patterns become opportunities for growth.



You care about doing things intentionally. You think things through, break them down clearly, notice details others miss, and bring a sense of order to what you take on.



You’re naturally curious... the kind of person who wants to understand how things work and why something is the way it is. You look for context, ask clarifying questions, and enjoy figuring things out until the “why” becomes clear. 



You move through life with a deep belief that everything is for your good. You don’t see challenges as setbacks, you see them as a puzzle to solve, a lesson to learn, or an opportunity for growth. At your core, you’re a glass-half-full person.



ABOUT US

We’re a technical services business currently supporting Cisco systems and moving into AI-based solutions.  As a tiny company, it will be just the owner and you. This means communication is direct, decisions are fast, and your work has a real impact on the business & its growth.



WHAT TO EXPECT

You will work directly with the owner keeping the day to day moving smoothly. Your role is to keep the business owner organized, accurate, and moving forward. You’ll have visibility into both business and personal logistics and be trusted to handle them with integrity and ownership.



WHAT YOU'LL OWN

  *
 MANAGEMENT: Monitor and organize business
, handle items you can resolve, flag or escalate high?priority messages, and screen requests so the owner only handles necessary
s.

  * PERSONAL METRICS TRACKING: Do a daily check in with the owner, update the performance spreadsheet, spot trends or anomalies, and prepare the weekly printed metrics.

  * TRAVEL PLANNING: Research and book flights, lodging, tours, and activities; deliver a complete itinerary and manage changes for about one trip per month.

  * PERSONAL SUPPORT: Schedule home maintenance, place orders/returns, and handle ad hoc personal tasks as requested.

  * BOOKKEEPING: In Quickbooks, enter timesheets for multiple clients, create/send invoices, record and categorize expenses and upload receipts.

  * TIMESHEETS & SOWs: Collect and verify time entries, transfer data into QB/Trello/spreadsheets, manage payroll or vendor support tickets to resolution, and update SOWs for review before sending.

  *PROJECT TRACKING: Maintain timesheets and to do lists in Trello, keep task statuses current, and ensure critical items are completed on time.

  * VISUAL DIAGRAMS: Create L
 flowcharts and XMind mind maps, capture live notes into mind maps, migrate maps into diagrams, and convert data between formats (like Excel ? mind map/diagram).



GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES

OPTIONAL: This role could grow into an AI TECHNICIAN. As the owner moves into AI, there is an optional opportunity to become an AI technical assistant.



COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

  * HOURS: Part-time starting at 15-20 hours a week, which may increase as needs increase.

  * COMPENSATION: $8 USD per hour, based on experience.

  * ON-CALL AVAILABILITY: Be available to respond within 20 minutes between 7:00 AM to 9:00 AM PHL time Tuesday to Saturday. You don’t need to actively be working during that time, just be available to reply to messages or join quick meetings so simple questions don’t have to wait until the next day.

  * MEETINGS: Weekly all-staff meeting at 7:00 AM on Wednesday (PHL Time), plus additional meetings as needed.

  *REMOTE WORK: Work from anywhere with flexible hours.

  * INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR: This is a contract position without benefits. Only direct workers should apply. No agencies, please.



HOW TO APPLY:

Please fill out this form: 





***NOTE: ONLY THOSE WHO FILL OUT THE NOTION FORM LINKED ABOVE WILL BE CONSIDERED FOR THE POSITION

title: ONLY REAL EXPERIENCED COLD CALLER & APPOINTMENT SETTER
description:
???????????????????? READ THIS BEFORE YOU APPLY



IF YOU COME FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE, CUSTOMER SUPPORT, BANK LOANS, DEBT COLLECTION, OR CALL CENTER INBOUND ROLES — DO NOT APPLY. THIS IS NOT THAT KIND OF ROLE. WE ARE LOOKING FOR PEOPLE WITH REAL OUTBOUND SALES AND COLD CALLING EXPERIENCE ONLY. IF YOU HAVE NEVER DIALED COLD LEADS FOR MARKETING AGENCIES AND PITCHED A STRANGER WITH NO PRIOR INTEREST, THIS JOB IS NOT FOR YOU. PLEASE MOVE ON. WE ARE NOT LOOKING FOR PEOPLE WHO FEEL THEY CAN DO IT, WE LOOKING FOR PEOPLE WHO HAVE DONE IT AND WILLING TO DO IT AGAIN.



HOW PAYMENT WORKS — READ CAREFULLY BEFORE APPLYING

Payment is released only when all 5,000 contacts have been called and all outcomes are fully logged. Partial completion does not qualify for payment under any circumstance.



Your earnings are determined by the number of confirmed bookings you produce:



Below 200 bookings — Project is considered incomplete. You receive a one-time flat payment of $300 USD only.

200–224 bookings (Quota 1 met) — You receive the base $300 USD plus a $175 USD bonus = $475 USD total.

225–249 bookings (Quota 2 met) — You receive the base $300 USD plus a $350 USD bonus = $650 USD total.

250+ bookings (Quota 3 met) — You receive the base $300 USD plus a $660 USD bonus = $950 USD total.



The minimum quota of 200 confirmed bookings must be met for full payment to be released without review. Hitting 250+ also opens the door to a monthly ongoing role — details below.



THE JOB

You will be given a list of 5,000 cold leads. Your job is to call every single one of them and book as many appointments as possible. Each lead must be attempted up to 3 times before being marked as unreachable. Calls must be made at varied times of day — do not call the same person back-to-back or at the same time each attempt. Use morning, midday, and afternoon/evening windows to maximize answer rates.



WHAT YOU NEED TO DO



Work through the full list of 5,000 leads systematically

- Attempt each lead up to 3 times at different times before marking as no-answer

- Pitch naturally, qualify quickly, and book the appointment

- Book only qualified prospects — do not say whatever it takes just to get someone on the calendar. A booking only counts if the lead genuinely fits our criteria, understands what the meeting is about, and has agreed to show up with real interest. - - Unqualified or misleading bookings will not count toward your quota and will reflect poorly on your performance review

- Enter all call outcomes and notes into our CRM or tracking sheet

- Send confirmation details to every booked prospect

- Call every booked prospect approximately 2 hours before their scheduled meeting to confirm they are still attending. If they need to reschedule, handle it on the spot, update the calendar, and log the change. No-shows that were not confirmed beforehand will not count as completed bookings

- Submit a final report of all outcomes when the list is complete



PERFORMANCE QUOTA

We expect real results from a real caller. Here is what the benchmark looks like:



200 bookings (4%) — Minimum to qualify for full payment

225 bookings (4.5%) — Strong performance

250+ bookings (5%+) — Outstanding performance, monthly role will be offered



Important: Bookings are only counted when they are qualified, confirmed, and the pre-meeting check-in call has been completed. Do not try to inflate your numbers with weak or misleading bookings — quality is reviewed alongside quantity.

The minimum to be considered complete and get paid in full is 200 confirmed appointments. Anything below that will be reviewed before payment is released. Hit 250 or above and we will be talking about bringing you on monthly.



REQUIREMENTS

- Proven outbound cold calling experience — this is mandatory

- Fluent, confident English with no heavy accent, mumbling, or filler words

- Sounds human and natural on the phone, not robotic

- Can handle rejection and keep dialing without losing energy

- Able to qualify leads accurately during the call — you must be able to identify genuine interest and fit, not just push anyone into a booking to hit numbers

- Disciplined with follow-through — you are responsible for calling every booked lead 2 hours before their meeting to confirm attendance or reschedule as needed. This is part of the job, not optional

- Reliable internet and a quality headset — audio must be clear

- Able to work independently with no supervision

- Must be able to complete the full project in a reasonable timeframe

- Familiar with CRM tools (GHL) or Google Sheets for tracking



COMPENSATION



$300 USD base — one-time flat payment (paid upon full list completion)

+$175 USD bonus if you hit Quota 1 (200–224 bookings)

+$250 USD bonus if you hit Quota 2 (225–249 bookings)

+$500 USD bonus if you hit Quota 3 (250+ bookings)



Payment is released only after all 5,000 contacts are called, all outcomes are logged, and results are verified.



WANT TO TURN THIS INTO SOMETHING BIGGER?



This gig is your audition. If you hit 250+ bookings and your quality is strong, we will offer you a monthly ongoing role with a consistent salary. Show us what you're made of and there is a real opportunity to build something long-term with us.

title: GHL Automation Specialist – Real Estate Media Systems Setup
description:
Job Overview:

We are a growing real estate media company in Utah, USA, looking for a technical GoHighLevel (GHL) Expert to build our automated marketing and CRM infrastructure. This is not a general VA role; we need a systems architect who understands logic, webhooks, and 10DLC compliance.



Key Responsibilities:



System Integration: Connect our real estate booking system (Aryeo) and our phone system (Quo) to GHL using APIs or Webhooks.



Review Automation: Build a smart review request logic that includes "cool-down" periods (ensuring a client never receives more than one review request every 30 days).



Segmentation & Sequences: Set up distinct
/SMS nurture sequences for New Clients, High-Volume Agents, and Lapsed Clients.



Compliance: Handle all A2P 10DLC registration and ensure all automated messaging includes proper opt-out language.



Database Management: Help clean and import agent lists from the MLS.



Technical Screening (Please read carefully):

To ensure we find the right fit for this technical build, please include the following in your application:



A short video intro (under 3 mins): Introduce yourself and explain a specific time you successfully connected a third-party API or Webhook to a GHL workflow.



The Logic Challenge: Briefly explain how you would set up a "Frequency Cap" in GHL so a client who books 3 shoots in one week only receives one review request text.

Note: Applications missing these two items will not be reviewed.



Technical Requirements:



2+ years of advanced GHL experience (Workflows, Funnels, Triggers).



Experience with 10DLC carrier registration in 2026.



Ability to provide Loom walkthroughs of all systems built.



Compensation & Logistics:



Type: Part-time / Project-based (potential for long-term maintenance).



Rate: $10–$15/hour (or flat project fee of $800–$1,200 for initial build).

title: VA Admin Support
description:
We’re looking for an Administrative Agent to help support our sales and recruiting teams. This is an entry-level position that is eligible for promotion after 12 months of tenure.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********



You will fail the application process if you don't read the entire job description.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********





About Us



Started in 2017, and we're growing like crazy.

We expect to hire at least 4 salespeople, 3 admins, and 3 marketers in 2026.

Growing FAST - We sold 2663 lessons in 2025, and we're on pace to sell 3328 lessons in 2026

A small team of 1 American and 10 Filipinos.

We sell manual transmission driving lessons in the United States. Yes, really.

100% inbound leads from Organic Search (SEO). We don’t do cold calling.

No competition - in 90% of the markets we serve, we have no competitors. Because of this, our sale is pretty easy to make.





Compensation and Benefits

Competitive commission package - $3.50 per hour

Paid 5 Sick Days - Effective on day 1

Paid 10 days vacation - Prorated

Paid 14 Bank holidays - (Legal and religious Holidays are country-specific)

Paid Birthday Off - you pick a day off

Business Continuity Plan - In cases of calamity $40 hotel accommodations are permitted to ensure work will continue



Type of Employment

Full Time

40 hours per week

Schedule - 9 AM to 5 PM EST



Benefits to be provided after completion of 3 months:

Health Insurance

Office equipment, home office furniture, and anything else you need for work

Learning books, courses, training, or coaching that you want



Benefits to be provided after completion of one year:

Paid two weeks off for the Christmas Season



Entry Level Details

Note that this is an entry-level job.

We do NOT expect you to have any prior sales experience.

If you’re looking to switch careers and get your foot in the door, this could be great for you.

This is a great opportunity for anyone with a background in any of the following areas: Customer Service, VA Admin, Admin Data Processing, Clerk,
 Communications, General VA, Admin Support, Sales and Admin Specialist, Administrative Support, Operations Admin, Executive Admin Assistant, Sales Assistant.





Duties and Responsibilities

New Orders - Processing Product Order (Gift Certificate)

New Orders - Initial Order Confirmation (Level 3)

Instructor Onboarding, Offboarding and Reonboarding

Reactivate Unavailable Instructor

Secret Message: When you apply, under the section that says "Is there anything else you'd like to write or include?", write the word PINK ELEPHANT. This will show us that you read the entire job description.

Duplicate Record Check

Updating the "Daily Tracking" Process

CTM Prospect Staging





Qualifications

At least 2-3 years of minimum work experience in a relevant or equivalent role

Comprehensive background in Customer and Administrative support

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Excellent English communication and comprehension

Proficiency in using and managing Google applications - Gmail, Calendar, Documents, Drive

Preferably with knowledge in using cloud-based CRM

Organized and has careful attention to detail

Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Strong Problem-Solving skills

Customer Service Oriented and the ability to adapt/respond properly to different types of scenarios

Equipped with good skills in office/admin management, and can suggest process improvements

Must have your own computer, reliable high-speed internet, and a good quality headset and microphone.





What's Hard About This Job

Working Remotely - We're a remote-first company, and we never want to have an office. This is great if you like working by yourself in the quiet, but it can be terribly painful if you need the energy of coworkers nearby.

Our Cultural Values - We're an American company with an incredibly unusual culture. Even by American standards, our 7 cultural values are highly unusual. Our culture is challenging for people accustomed to corporate culture and especially difficult for people who grew up in Confucian cultures. It's a great culture for people who speak directly and have a great deal of self-confidence and ownership. If you identify as a misfit, you'll do well.

Multiple Software Systems - You're going to need to learn how to use 12 different software systems. This is great if you want to get exposed to and experience lots of technology, but it can be tough if you have a hard time learning technology. Secret Message - When you apply, you'll see a box that asks if you want to add anything else. Type in PINK ELEPHANT in all capital letters exactly as we've shown it here.





Cheat Code for getting a job with us:

1) Our application comprises the majority of our recruiting process. Because of that, we suggest that you give us thoughtful responses and rich stories. We typically only interview applicants who give rich and detailed answers to our questions. If you write short responses so that you can hurry up and finish the application, you will not get interviewed.

2) Tell us stories about how your actions match your beliefs and values. For example, if I say I value health and fitness, you don't know if I'm telling you the truth or if I'm just telling you what sounds good. But, if I tell you things I've done, I can illustrate my values of health and fitness with proof. For example, I go to the gym 4 days per week, I've done 6 triathlons, including an Ironman, and I can swim 3000 meters in one hour. My examples of things I've done prove that my actions match my values system.

3) Be vulnerable and honest. We take very detailed notes during the interview process, and we conduct extensive background checks. If the stories you tell about yourself don't match what your references say, we will not hire you. We'd rather hire a C student who is honest about being a C student than someone who is a C student but tries to pass themselves off as an A student. Remember, this is an entry-level job. We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for an excellent cultural fit.





How to apply: Please click on the link: 
/work-opportunities/administration-agent

title: Virtual Assistant for Online Herbal Education Brand
description:
Hi there!



We are an online herbal education business on a mission to help people learn how to use herbal remedies, and natural healthcare in a safe and sustainable way.



We’re a small caring team that loves to engage with each other, while getting the work done, and we’re looking for our next perfect fit!

We create content, courses, and community to make that happen. We’re a fun, fresh, friendly, and informative brand, and leaders in the herbal education industry. We pride ourselves in being a trusted space to get solid herbal information backed by science, and blended with traditional wisdom that science hasn’t paid for, and actually living this life. 



On a bigger picture, we make the complexities of herbalism simple and easy to understand. 

We are growing, and we are looking for a virtual assistant (or maybe two!) who wants to be part of something that’s making a positive impact in the world, not just a task master, though the tasks are important. We want someone who actually gets excited about herbal medicine, loves beautiful content, and takes pride in doing things well. 



We do NOT want loads of AI generated content!  While we do use AI as a tool, we really love and value the human touch. We’re seeking someone who can feel the brand, the natural vibes of it, and help connect to our ideal customers. 



Hours are flexible and light to start (around 5 to 20 per week), with busier seasons when we run summits and launches. While the hours may be variable, we are seeking a long-term partner to build a lasting valuable relationship for all.  This is not a short one and done gig.

Our last VA we worked with for 4 years but her life changed, and she’s moving on. Our other VA has also been with us for 4 years, and we’re still working and growing together.





What You Would Be Helping With - 



We are looking for support across some or all of these areas, depending on your strengths:



Content & Design

Canva graphics for social media posts, story templates, and class slides

Keeping our visual brand consistent and polished across everything

Social Media

Planning and scheduling content across YouTube, Pinterest, Instagram,
, and TikTok

Repurposing podcast content into short-form reels and social clips

Suggesting social media strategy, and working with the founder (also the face of the brand) to outline the content

Podcast & Video

Podcast editing and publishing

Cutting podcast recordings into reels and YouTube-ready videos

Kajabi

Building and updating pages (sales pages, landing pages, blog posts)

Course building and content uploads

General platform management and keeping things tidy



You do not need to do all of these. If you are a specialist in one or two areas, we would love to hear from you. If you are more of a generalist who can move across platforms, that is wonderful too.





Tech We Use -



Canva

Kajabi

Asana

Google Suite


Zoom



Hello Audio

Audacity

Descript

Capcut

Loom

Instagram


TikTok

YouTube

Pinterest 

While this is a list of what we use in our business, you do not have to know them all, though bonus points if you do.  We’re happy to train the right person/people in the right platforms as needed.  If you have experience with them all, even better. But, don’t let the idea of not knowing them all keep you from responding.



Who We Are Looking For-



While your skills are super important, we’re even more eager to find the right fit for this/these role/s. Here is what we genuinely care about:



You have a real interest in natural health, herbal remedies, nature, or holistic living. You do not have to be an expert, just curious and aligned with this way of life.

You are a self-starter who notices things and takes initiative without needing to be reminded.

You’re creative, and have ideas you’re not afraid to share.

You understand the online business landscape, and how to build new relationships and connections with customers.

You care about the details. A misaligned logo or a typo in a caption is something that bugs you too.

You communicate clearly and kindly, and you ask questions when something is not clear.

You want to get to know, and grow with a brand, not just complete tasks for it.





The Fun Part: To Apply, We Need A Few Things From You

This is where you get to show us a little of who you are. We read every reply, and we notice when people actually pay attention.



1- In your subject, or top of your reply to this, please TELL US YOUR FAVORITE FLOWER.  I will not read replies that do not have this in the subject line. This is how I know you’re paying attention.



2- Somewhere in your reply, let us know what draws you to the world of herbs and natural health, even just a little.



That is it. Just introduce yourself, tell us what you do, share those two things, and include any relevant links or portfolio samples if you have them.



Thanks for taking the time.

So excited to meet you!



Mel - The Herbalist's Path

About the Role



I run a growing online media business and I’m looking for a highly organised, reliable tea
mber to help manage workflows, document processes, and automate repeated tasks.



This is not a social media posting or content creator role.

This position focuses on organisation, systems, and operational support so the business runs smoothly without constant supervision.



You will help turn daily business activities into clear, repeatable processes.



Core Responsibilities

Workflow & Operations Management

Opportunity to grow responsibilities over time

Automations

 (Integromat)

title: GoHighLevel Certified Admin | GHL Onboarding & Automation Specialist (Part-Time, Long-Term)
description:
Job Description



Are you a HighLevel Certified Admin who enjoys building clean, scalable account setups?



I run a US-based marketing and automation company. We onboard service-based businesses into our GoHighLevel platform and build automations, AI systems, and funnels that convert leads into appointments.



I am looking for a sharp, detail-oriented GoHighLevel specialist to take new client accounts from signed agreement to fully launched.



This is not a beginner role.



You must already be very comfortable inside GoHighLevel and understand DNS, automations, and deliverability.



If you enjoy technical setup, clean execution, and solving small logic problems, this will be a great fit.



?



Core Responsibilities



You will be responsible for:



• A2P Registration

Coach clients through what needs to be added to their website for A2P approval, or implement it yourself.



• DNS Setup for Deliverability

Update client DNS records (SPF, DKIM, DMARC, subdomains) to ensure proper
 and link tracking deliverability.



• Sub-Account Configuration

Properly configure new sub-accounts using our internal standards.



• Closebot Integration

Add new sub-accounts as sources inside Closebot.



• Automation Customization

Modify workflows and automations based on each client’s needs.



• Funnel Customization

Update templated funnels to match client branding, offer, and messaging.



• Custom Values & Dynamic Data

Ensure all custom values are updated properly so automations fire correctly.



• Marketer’s Toolkit Setup

Add location information and apply correct permission structures.



• Light Troubleshooting

Diagnose and fix minor AI or automation logic issues when clients report unexpected behavior.



?



Required Qualifications



• HighLevel Certified Admin (please confirm in your application)

• Strong hands-on experience inside GoHighLevel

• Strong understanding of DNS (SPF, DKIM, DMARC, CNAME, A records)

• Comfortable working inside workflows and conditional logic

• Excellent attention to detail

• Strong written English

• Able to follow SOPs but also think independently



Bonus:



• Agency experience

• Experience with AI bot configuration

• Experience working with US clients

• Familiarity with Closebot



?



Hours & Expectations



• 10 to 20 hours per week to start

• Must overlap at least 2 to 3 hours with US Central Time

• Long-term role with potential for full-time

• Performance-based pay increases



?



How to Apply (Read Carefully)



Answer the following:

 1. Are you a HighLevel Certified Admin? If yes, how long?

 2. How many GHL sub-accounts have you personally onboarded from scratch?

 3. Explain how you would configure SPF, DKIM, and DMARC for a new domain.

 4. What is the most complex workflow you have built inside HighLevel?

 5. How many hours per week are you available?

       6. At the top of your application write Muffins Are Good. 

       7. If a client’s
s are landing in spam even though SPF passes, what are the first three things you would check?



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.



?



Screening Process



Shortlisted applicants will complete:



Step 1: 10-minute technical questionnaire

Step 2: Paid test task (2 to 3 hours)

Step 3: Short Zoom interview



?



Paid Test Task Example



Applicants who move forward will be paid to:



• Set up a test sub-account

• Configure a basic workflow with conditional logic

• Create custom values and apply them to a funnel

• Draft a DNS record configuration plan for deliverability



This helps us ensure we are aligned on quality before long-term engagement.



?



Growth Path



This role can evolve into:



• Full GHL Systems Manager

• Automation Architect

• Client Implementation Lead



We are building infrastructure for scale, and the right operator can grow with us.

title: YouTube Podcast/Video Editor for Herbal Brands - Health - Wellness - Natural Living
description:
Hi there!



We're seeking a special Podcast/Youtube Video Editor for our herbal brands.

You would be working across two herbal brands that share a deep love for plant medicine, natural health, and making herbalism accessible to everyday people. Both are all about herbal remedies, only one is e-commerce herbal products, while the other is online herbal education.



The first is an online herbal education brand focused on the herbalist's path, helping people learn how to use herbal remedies and natural healthcare safely and sustainably. We're fun, fresh, friendly, and informative, and we take pride in blending solid science with traditional wisdom and real lived experience.



The second is Eclectic Herb, a trusted herbal product line with a long, respected legacy in the herbalism space. Same natural vibes, different expression of it all.



You would primarily work with one point of contact (that's me!) for direction and feedback across both brands, with occasional input from the owner of Eclectic Herb. You'll be serving two aligned missions with one clear relationship at the center.



We're a small, caring team that loves to actually engage with each other while getting great work done. This is not a faceless gig. We genuinely value the people we work with, and our track record shows it. Our current VA has been with us for four years and counting. Our last one was with us for four years too before life took her in a new direction.





What This Role Is Really About - 



Both brands record podcast content via Zoom, and that raw recording becomes the foundation for everything. Your job is to take that one recording and turn it into multiple pieces of polished, engaging content across formats. This takes both technical skill and genuine creative instincts.



Hours are flexible and will typically run between 5 and 20 per week, with busier seasons around summits and launches. We value quality over quantity, and we'll grow the hours together as the relationship builds.



Here is what that looks like:



Podcast Editing -

Clean, professional editing of full podcast episodes

Publishing to podcast platforms via BuzzSprout

Handling intro and outro, audio leveling, and removing the stuff that doesn't need to be there



YouTube Production - 

Editing the same Zoom recording into a polished, watchable YouTube video

Titles, descriptions, and basic SEO thinking to help the content get found

Understanding what makes someone keep watching, not just click

Create eye catching YouTube thumbnails for each video

Using brand aligned b-roll for the edits



Short-Form Reels and Clips - 

Pulling the most compelling, thought-provoking 
nts from each episode

Editing into short-form vertical content for Instagram, TikTok, and

Adding captions, light graphics, b-roll, or text overlays as needed

This is where your instincts really matter. We need someone who can feel what will stop the scroll.

YouTube Strategy and Growth

Bringing ideas and insight to help both channels grow over time

Staying current on what is working on YouTube and short-form video

Thinking beyond just editing and into how content connects with the right audience





Tech We Use - 



These are the tools across both brands. You do not need to know them all, but the video and audio ones are important for this role. We are happy to train the right person where needed, so do not let an unfamiliar tool keep you from reaching out.



Core for This Role:

Descript

Audacity

Zoom

Capcut

BuzzSprout

YouTube

Canva

Instagram / TikTok /

Asana


Loom



Also in Our World:

Kajabi

Shopify

Google Suite

Microsoft Office Suite

Hello Audio

Pinterest





Who We Are Looking For -



Skills matter a lot for this one, but so does brand awareness and alignment. We need someone who can watch or listen to a conversation about herbs and instinctively know which thirty seconds is going to make someone stop, watch, and share.



You have a genuine feel for natural health, herbalism, or holistic living. You do not have to be a herbalist, but this world should resonate with you.

You are a strong video editor who understands pacing, storytelling, and what holds attention.

You think like a YouTube viewer, not just an editor.

You are a self-starter who brings ideas, not just deliverables.

You care about details. A jump cut that is a frame too long or a caption that is slightly off bothers you.

You communicate clearly, ask good questions, and are easy to work with across distance.

You want a long-term creative partnership, not a one-off project.

You want to live and breathe the brands when you work for us.



A note on AI: we use it as a tool, and we are fine with you doing the same where it makes sense. But we do not want AI-generated content standing in for genuine creative judgment. The human eye, ear, and instinct are what we are hiring.





How to Apply - 



We read every reply, and we notice when people are actually paying attention.



1- In your subject line or at the very top of your reply: TELL US YOUR FAVORITE FLOWER. Replies without this will not be read. It is our way of knowing you made it all the way through.



2- Share a clip or video you edited that you are genuinely proud of, and tell us in one or two sentences why it works. We want to see how you think, not just what you can do.



3- Tell us what draws you to the world of herbs and natural health, even just a little. This does not need to be a long answer. Just something real.



Beyond that, just introduce yourself, tell us what you do, and include any relevant links or portfolio samples.



Thanks for taking the time.

So excited to meet you!



Mel - The Herbalist's Path | Eclectic Herb

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Scale a Real Estate AI SaaS to 100k+ Users)
description:
Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term | Growth Role



We are building GoButterfly.ai — a next-generation AI-powered property management platform designed to make owning real estate truly passive.



The MVP is built using Lovable, and now we are entering the next phase:



- Productionalizing the product

- Scaling infrastructure

- Hardening workflows

- Preparing for hundreds of thousands of users



This is NOT a beginner role. We need someone who understands how to turn a working MVP into a scalable, production-ready SaaS.







What You’ll Be Responsible For



You will work directly with the founder to:



* Refactor and productionalize our Lovable-built MVP

* Architect scalable backend systems

* Optimize database performance

* Design infrastructure that can handle 100k+ concurrent users

* Ensure all AI and workflow automations run reliably

* Set up monitoring, logging, and error tracking

* Improve API performance and rate limiting

* Strengthen authentication and security

* Implement CI/CD pipelines

* Build a clean, scalable codebase for long-term growth



This role is about systems thinking, scalability, and reliability — not just feature building.







Tech Stack (Current + Target)



* Lovable (MVP foundation)

* Next.js

* Supabase (Auth + DB)

* Stripe

* OpenAI API

* Vercel

* Background job systems (
v or similar)

* Web scraping integrations (Apify or similar)



If you’ve scaled SaaS products before, we want to hear from you.







You’re a Great Fit If You:



* Have 5+ years of full-stack experience

* Have scaled a SaaS platform to large user counts

* Understand database indexing and performance tuning

* Know infrastructure scaling (cloud, serverless, load balancing)

* Think in systems, not just tickets

* Write clean, maintainable code

* Have strong English communication

* Are proactive and solution-oriented

* Can take ownership and think like a CTO



Bonus if:



* You’ve worked on AI-based products

* You’ve built multi-tenant SaaS

* You’ve handled large background job workflows

* You understand SaaS billing architecture







Compensation



* Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

* Performance bonuses

* Long-term opportunity

* Potential leadership path (Head of Engineering)



This is a serious long-term position. We are not hiring for short-term freelance work.





Send:



1. Links to SaaS products you’ve built or scaled

2. What the biggest system you’ve architected handled (users/traffic)

3. Your GitHub

4. A short Loom explaining how you would productionalize a Lovable-built MVP

5. The word “Butterfly” in your subject line



Applications without this will not be considered.





We are building something meaningful in the real estate space. If you want to help scale a real SaaS company from early traction to massive scale — this is your opportunity.



Let’s build something big.



— Ryan

Founder, GoButterfly.ai

title: Texas Sales & AI Growth Operator ($2,450+ OTE)
description:
Texas Sales & AI Growth Operator ($2,450+ OTE / Long-Term 10-Hour Work Week)



READ THIS FIRST



We are not looking for a basic virtual assistant.



We are building a long-term partnership with a high-level operator who wants to grow with us for years.



This role is life-changing for the right person.



Applications are only accepted through our official application form.



If you are just looking for short-term VA work — this is NOT for you.



?



THE MISSION



We are a Texas-based AI automation agency scaling from zero to dominance.



We need a driven Growth Operator who can:

	•	scrape high-quality Texas leads

	•	quickly customize proven website templates

	•	support and assist sales conversations

	•	manage GoHighLevel workflows

	•	confidently help close deals

	•	help us build to 150 active clients



Once we reach 150 clients, your workload drops permanently.



We want you to enjoy what you helped build.



?



PHASE 1 — THE SPRINT (Months 1–12)



Objective: Reach 150 active clients

Schedule: Full-time (40 hours/week)

Shift: Night shift required (to match Texas hours)



?



Daily Performance Targets

	•	50 qualified leads per day

	•	Fast template customization per client

	•	CRM updates in GoHighLevel

	•	Assist sales pipeline

	•	Target: 22 sales per month



?



PHASE 1 COMPENSATION

	•	Base Pay: $600/month

	•	Commissions:

	•	$50 per sale

	•	$100 per sale

	•	$150 per sale



OTE: $2,450+ USD/month

Top performers can exceed this.



?



PHASE 2 — THE FREEDOM (After 150 Clients)



Once the client village is built:

	•	Workload drops to approximately 10 hours per week

	•	Mostly maintenance and retention

	•	Light monitoring



?



PHASE 2 PAY

	•	$1,500 Base

	•	$500 Loyalty Bonus

	•	$5,000 Annual Bonus



Target earnings: approximately $2,500/month part-time



Because we want you to enjoy what you built.



Our goal is a 10+ year partnership.



?



UNICORN BENEFITS



The 22-Sale Rule (Primary Time-Off Benefit)



If you hit 22 sales early in the month:

	•	You may take the rest of the month off

	•	Full pay still applies

	•	Performance creates freedom



?



$5,000 Performance Bonus



Paid:

	•	annually

or

	•	when the agency hits $300k gross



?



Annual Tech Grant (Laptop Upgrade Program)



After 6 months of strong performance:

	•	$1,000 Tech Grant provided annually

	•	Intended for upgrading your laptop or workstation

	•	Ensures you always operate at peak speed



High performers will always have professional-grade equipment.



?



Education Support Benefit



After 12 months of strong performance:

	•	Up to $1,000 per year contributed toward private school tuition for your child(ren)

	•	Designed to support long-term stability for our top operators



?



Structured Work Schedule



This role operates on a defined daily execution system.



You will be provided with:

	•	a fixed shift schedule

	•	daily activity blocks

	•	lead generation targets

	•	build and follow-up windows



You must be comfortable executing inside a structured system and maintaining consistent daily output.



?



Daily Performance Reporting (Required)



You must submit a brief end-of-shift report each workday.



Your report will include:

	•	number of leads scraped

	•	websites customized

	•	conversations handled

	•	sales assisted or closed

	•	any blockers encountered



Consistency and transparency are mandatory in this role.



Failure to report consistently will be treated as a performance issue.



?



Performance Environment



We operate in a fast-moving execution environment.



The ideal candidate:

	•	moves quickly without sacrificing accuracy

	•	takes ownership of outcomes

	•	solves problems without waiting to be told

	•	communicates proactively



If you prefer slow, highly supervised work, this role will not be a good fit.



?



Role Focus



Preference will be given to candidates who can dedicate primary professional focus to this role.



We are building a long-term partnership and value operators who want to grow deeply with one team.



?



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



Applicants without these will be rejected.



?



Technical

	•	GoHighLevel experience required

	•	GHL Snapshot expert strongly preferred

	•	CRM pipeline management

	•	Basic automation understanding

	•	Landing page or template editing experience

	•	Lead scraping experience (Outscraper preferred)



?



Sales and Communication

	•	Proven sales support or closing experience

	•	Comfortable closing deals in the $750–$1,120 range

	•	Able to confidently present a $500/month service

	•	Strong written English

	•	Confident phone presence

	•	Objection handling ability

	•	Follow-up discipline



?



Spoken English Requirement



Because this role involves client communication and sales conversations with U.S. businesses, the ideal candidate must demonstrate:

	•	clear, neutral spoken English

	•	strong verbal confidence on live calls

	•	easy-to-understand pronunciation

	•	professional phone presence



Your video submission will be used to evaluate communication clarity and call readiness.



Candidates who are difficult to understand on live calls will not be considered.



?



Work Discipline

	•	Night shift experience (U.S. hours)

	•	Stable high-speed internet

	•	Quiet work environment

	•	Detail-oriented

	•	Fast executor



?



DO NOT APPLY IF

	•	You miss deadlines

	•	You disappear during shifts

	•	You need constant supervision

	•	You have never used GoHighLevel

	•	You are juggling too many clients



We are building something serious.



?



YOUR CORE TOOLS

	•	LandingSite.ai

	•	GoHighLevel (heavy usage)

	•	Outscraper



Full SOPs provided.



?



VIDEO INTRODUCTION (REQUIRED)



Serious operators show up on camera.



As part of your application, you must submit a 2–3 minute video introduction.



Applications without video will be automatically rejected.



?



In your video, answer:

	1.	Introduce yourself and your background

	2.	Describe your GoHighLevel experience (especially snapshots)

	3.	Explain your sales or closing experience

	4.	Confirm your night shift availability

	5.	Briefly explain why you are a strong fit for this long-term role



?



Video Requirements

	•	Clear audio (no heavy background noise)

	•	Camera on (face visible)

	•	Professional communication

	•	Natural speaking (do not read like a robot)

	•	Upload via Loom, YouTube (unlisted), or Google Drive (link only)



?



Automatic Rejection If

	•	No video submitted

	•	Camera off

	•	Under 60 seconds

	•	Clearly scripted or AI-read

	•	Poor audio quality



?



ATTENTION TO DETAIL CHECK (REQUIRED)



To confirm you fully read this post, include this word in your application:



BLUECACTUS47



Applications missing this word will be automatically rejected.



?



Quiet Attention Check



Serious applicants pay attention to details.



When submitting your application, include the word:



VelvetHammer



Somewhere naturally in your application responses.



Do not mention why.



?
