title: Amazon FBA Product Researcher - Online Arbitrage
description:
In late last year we began selling on Amazon and have already seen tremendous growth. Because of this, we want to bring on help to help in daily tasks and continue growing the business!



We're specifically looking for someone to source amazon products through online arbitrage. Our minimum weekly criteria is 15-20 quality leads that we can purchase.



Pattern wholesale experience is preferred. And the sourcing software's Keepa and SellerAMP will be provided.



Before we hire you, you're required to complete a 3 day trial phase. During this phase you will be paid $1.50 per hour and after the trial phase, we will evaluate and make our hiring decision. After the initial phase your wage will be increased to $3 dollars per hour. After 180 days we will re-evaluate your performance and you will be considered for a raise of your base pay. We want to provide you an opportunity for long-term growth and give you a chance to be rewarded for hard work, with the possibility of managing other VAs as you become more senior.



Bonuses are available on a monthly basis with more leads and more profit leading to a greater bonus. To ensure you're fully reading this, please put Amazon Scaling in your subject line. Everything will be explained to you during our initial call.



Training will be frequent covering new sourcing methods, ways to analyze data, and you will receive feedback on your work. Furthermore, your performance and hours will be tracked with Hubstaff.



In your application please provide your Teams information or your whatsapp information, so I can contact you and schedule a call to review expectations and criteria.

The audio file for each video

This is a test project to see if we can work together. If successful, there may be long-term work with multiple additional videos produced in the same way.

title: Virtual Administrative Assistant - City Permits for Home Services (HVAC, Plumbing, Electrical)
description:
Job Description:

We are a US Based company looking to hire an experienced Permit Expeditor. A Permit Expeditor is responsible for managing the end-to-end process of securing city permits on behalf of contractors. This includes preparing applications, submitting them to city portals, following up on open jobs, resolving issues with city departments, contractors and homeowners, and updating clients on progress. Online runners handle city submissions through online portals,
, and phone communications.



Key Responsibilities:

• Review contractor-provided documentation for accuracy and completeness before submission.

• Submit permit applications through city or county online portals or via
, following jurisdiction-specific requirements.

• Communicate professionally with city officials to resolve missing information, clarifications, or additional requirements.

• Track the status of permit applications and proactively follow up until the permit is issued.

• Update internal systems (CRM Portal) with accurate notes and status changes.

• Notify clients (contractors) of permit progress, fees, or additional steps needed.

• Ensure all required attachments, corrections, or revisions are submitted on time.



Skills & Qualifications:

• Outside the box thinker

• Strong attention to detail and ability to follow jurisdiction-specific requirements.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.

• Strong problem-solving skills and persistence when following up with cities.

• Tech-savvy and comfortable working with online portals,
, and internal systems.



Software Applications we Commonly Use:

• Zoho

• Airtable

• 

• Ring Central

• Excel



Hours:

• 40 Hours per week, Monday - Friday

• 8AM-4PM PST USA

• (may change to earlier hours to start such as 5AM PST)

• Candidates must be flexible in working hours.



Type of Online Runners we Need:

• Very Detail-Oriented: They must carefully follow city instructions and ensure all paperwork is accurate.

• Persistent and Organized: They should follow up consistently with cities and manage multiple permits without losing track.

• Professional Communicators: Able to
, call, and document interactions clearly and respectfully.

• Quick Learners: Comfortable adapting to different city processes and online platforms.

• Reliable and Self-Managed: Since they work remotely, they need to stay productive and accountable without direct supervision.



Other Requirements:

• Reliable Internet

• Reliable Power Source

• Preferably 2 monitors for multi-tasking

• Clear communication in English



We are looking for long-term, highly dedicated outside the box thinkers. Candidates must be able to push through difficult work times and have a go-getter mentality.

you have read this entire post.

clips, and clear voiceovers.

You have a strong portfolio of AI-generated images (Midjourney, DALL-E 3),

videos (RunwayML, Pika Labs), and voiceovers (ElevenLabs, Play.ht).

You are obsessed with detail and following instructions perfectly.

You love systems and processes and find satisfaction in executing a proven

formula.

You are fast, reliable, and highly organized.

What We Offer:

100% Remote Work: Work from anywhere.

Clear Instructions: You will receive a detailed brief for every project. No

guesswork.

Innovative Environment: Be part of a team that is at the cutting edge of AI in

advertising.

Consistent Workflow: A steady stream of projects from our diverse client base.

To Apply:

1. Start your cover letter with the words “AI Creative”.

2. Provide a link to your portfolio that includes both Canva video ads and AIgenerated content.

3. Briefly explain why you are the perfect fit for a production-focused role.

title: Operations-First Growth VA (Meta Ads–Capable) – Maui Dog Ranch
description:
Job Title

Operations-First Growth VA (Meta Ads–Capable) – Maui Dog Ranch

Location

Remote (Philippines preferred)

Strong written English required

2–3 hours overlap with Hawaii time (HST)

Hours & Pay

• 10–15 hours/week to start

• $8–12/hour USD (based on experience)

• Paid weekly via Wise or PayPal

• Role can scale with performance

About Us

Olowalu Dog Ranch is a premium dog boarding, day camp, and training ranch on Maui, Hawaii. We specialize in free-range play, River Adventure Hikes, structured training, and selective high-ticket board & train programs.

This is a real, physical business with staff, dogs, and daily operations. The priority is calm, reliable systems first — then efficient growth.

Role Overview (Read Carefully)

This is an operations-first role with a clearly defined transition into growth execution.

Phase 1: Stabilize and streamline operations so nothing falls through the cracks.

Phase 2: Once systems are calm and approved, take over Meta ads, basic social posting, and local SEO support for low-commitment services.

Growth is the destination — not the starting point.

Tools You’ll Work With

• Gingr – boarding, day camp, memberships, vaccination tracking

• Wix – training and assessment pages

• Google Sheets / Docs – tracking and SOPs

• Zapier – light automation (when approved)

• Meta Business Manager – later phase (ads)

• Instagram /
 – basic posting

• Google Business Profile – local SEO basics

Responsibilities

Phase 1: Operations Stabilization (First 2–4 Weeks)

• Build and maintain a clear lead tracker

• Set up follow-up workflows and reminders

• Clean calendars and booking confirmations

• Document intake SOPs (meet & greets, assessments, board & train referral path)

• Reduce manual work and staff confusion

• Prepare growth infrastructure without launching:

•  Meta pixel installation

•  Audience setup

•  Creative organization

•  Google Business Profile audit?(No ads, no posting, no spend yet)

Phase 2: Growth Execution (After Approval)

• Launch and manage efficient Meta ads for:

•  $50 meet & greets

•  $150 training assessments

•  Boarding / day camp awareness

•  (Local Maui/Hawaii focus, A/B creatives, monitor CPL/lead quality)?• Nurture leads toward high-ticket board & train (invite-only via owner consults)?• Handle basic Instagram/Facebook posting (scheduling, captions, Canva)?• Support local SEO basics:

•  Google Business Profile optimization

•  Review encouragement workflows

•  Citation consistency?• Provide simple weekly performance summaries

Authority & Boundaries (Non-Negotiable)

You may independently implement operational improvements that:

• reduce steps

• reduce manual work

• simplify staff workload

You may NOT change or implement:

• pricing or rates

• memberships

• packages or discounts

• policies affecting revenue or client expectations

Any change touching pricing, revenue, or policies must be:

Documented ? Recommended ? Approved before implementation

Growth execution (ads/social/SEO) begins only after Phase 1 is complete and approved.

Required Experience

• Operations/process streamlining for small businesses

• Meta/Facebook ads for local service businesses (lead gen, pixel, audiences)

• Basic social media management

• Local SEO fundamentals (Google Business Profile, reviews, citations)

• Detail-oriented, calm, and reliable

• Strong written English

Nice to Have

• Pet or local service business experience

• Canva and Zapier familiarity

• Gingr or Wix experience

How to Apply

Please include:

1.  Resume or brief work history

2.  Meta ads examples (screenshots/results, typical CPL for local services)

3.  Short answer: “How do you approach fixing operations before turning on ads?”

4.  Brief note on local SEO / Google Business Profile experience

5.  Availability and time zone

Shortlisted applicants will complete a paid test task.

Important Note

We value clarity, follow-through, and calm execution over speed or hype.

This is ready to post. It balances everything we discussed: ops-first, clear sequencing, high-ticket nurturing, ad/social/SEO efficiency, and authority protection.

, and other platforms.

 (updates, pricing, availability).

title: SOCIAL MEDIA VA – HUBSPOT ENGAGEMENT & COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT
description:
ABOUT VSL

Vanderburgh Sober Living is a nonprofit organization that supports addiction recovery group homes across the United States. We exist to make community-based sober housing more accessible, and we do this by equipping and supporting local operators through shared standards, tools, and services.



WHY WORK HERE?

We pay well and treat our team with respect and transparency. Our VAs have real growth opportunities and a voice in how work gets done. We do not micromanage or use invasive time trackers because we hire professionals and trust them to perform. In return, we expect high standards, strong execution, and consistent follow-through. We are not building a revolving door of short-term hires. We are building a long-term team of A-players who take ownership, deliver results, and want to grow with a mission-driven organization. Learn more: 



POSITION SUMMARY

We are hiring a Social Media VA focused on disciplined posting, daily engagement, and CRM follow-through inside HubSpot. This is not primarily a content-creation role. You will use Canva templates we provide, post strategically through HubSpot, and actively manage conversations that turn into qualified inquiries. We compensate well and expect strong performance. We are not looking to cycle through VAs or hire short-term side hustlers. We want long-term A-players who take ownership, execute consistently, and grow with the company.



DUTIES

-- Monitor social platforms daily and follow up on DMs throughout the workday.

-- Respond to comments and messages professionally and move qualified conversations into HubSpot CRM.

QUALIFICATIONS

-- Experience: 3+ years managing social media for U.S.-based businesses.

-- English: strong written and conversational fluency.

-- Tools & software: HubSpot (Marketing & CRM), Canva, Meta Business Suite, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Office.

-- Skills: detail-oriented, disciplined, organized, proactive, strong follow-through, and able to execute without constant oversight.

-- Internet & setup: reliable high-speed connection, backup plan, and quiet workspace.



SCHEDULE

40 hours per week, flexible hours with 50% overlap with U.S. Eastern Time, Monday through Friday.



COMPENSATION

We compensate well for experienced professionals and offer long-term growth opportunities. Please include your desired monthly or hourly USD rate in your application.



HOW TO APPLY

-- Include: a short introduction, your social media experience, your expected rate, your weekly availability, and a link to your portfolio or examples of work.

-- Briefly describe your experience using HubSpot for scheduling and engagement.

title: Remote Sales Representative— Landscaping & Pest Control | $8/hr + Commission + Bonuses

mbers who are already thriving with us. We’ve got your back from day one.

How to Apply

title: Senior Graphic Designer + Portfolio Buildout Specialist (Web + Mockup + A.I. + Motion)
description:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT:



I am looking for someone who is focused on innovation, trends, and the "what's next" in the design world. I am NOT looking for someone who creates designs for corporate brands or standard marketing materials that can't break that mold. Must be able to break the marketing mold and instead develop designs that communicate a feeling and are "looks" forward. Your portfolio MUST show this and your ability to develop cool projects not just corporate used assets. I'm an experienced Art Director and Graphic Designer based in the U.S. looking to build a standout portfolio that truly reflects the caliber of my work. The problem isn't the work — it's the time. I'm buried in client projects and need a talented, senior-level creative partner to take everything I've already designed and transform it into a polished, dynamic, and visually impressive portfolio website and project presentation system.

This is not a task-taking role. I want a true collaborator — someone who will absorb my vision, contribute their own creative ideas, push back when they have a better solution, and help elevate the final result beyond what either of us could do alone.



The Website: 
v or Comparable Platform (This Is Critical)

My portfolio site is currently being built on 
v, an AI-powered web design platform, and this piece of the project is just as important as the design work itself. Here's why this matters so much: once the project is complete, I need to be able to manage, edit, and add to the site myself — without hiring a developer every time I want to swap out a project or update a section. 
v makes this possible through its AI chat-based editing interface, which lets non-developers make real changes without touching code. If you are experienced with 
v, you move to the top of the list immediately.

That said, I am open to other platforms — but only if they meet the same criteria:

- The site must be a real, live, published website (not a mockup or template PDF)

- I must be able to edit and add to it myself after handoff without needing to rehire

- It should support a visually rich, modern, and dynamic design — not a cookie-cutter template look



If you're proposing an alternative to 
v, tell me specifically what platform you'd use, why it's better for this project, and how it gives me the same self-service editing capability. I'm open to the conversation — just come with a clear recommendation and reasoning.



WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:



- Taking my existing design files (print, social, logo/branding, vector assets, etc.) across multiple campaigns and brands and building cohesive, story-driven project presentations

- Placing designs onto high-quality 4K photorealistic mockups so the work comes to life beyond flat files

- Crafting visual storyboards and case study layouts that communicate the creative strategy and execution behind each project

- Building and publishing the actual portfolio website on 
v or an agreed-upon alternative that meets the self-editing requirement

- Incorporating motion graphics or subtle animations to make the portfolio feel modern and dynamic (AI-assisted motion is acceptable)

- Maintaining a strong understanding of American design culture and what resonates with U.S.-based hiring teams and creative directors





REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:



- Senior-level graphic design experience — strong eye and deep experience across branding, print, and digital

- Mockup & presentation design — expert-level ability to composite designs onto 4K realistic mockups and build compelling case study layouts

- Web design AND development — you need to build a real, live, published site, not just design it in Figma and call it done

- 
v experience — strongly preferred; if you have it, lead with it

- Motion graphics / animation — at minimum, comfortable using AI tools to add movement and life to portfolio pieces

- AI design tools — proficient with AI-powered design workflows (Higgsfield, Nano Banana Pro, Firefly, or similar)

- Strong grasp of American aesthetics and design culture — this portfolio targets U.S. companies and hiring directors, so your sensibility needs to reflect that





WHAT I AM NOT LOOKING FOR:



A "yes person." I don't want someone who just executes instructions. I want someone who reviews my inspiration, understands the goal, and brings their own strong creative perspective to the table. If you have a better idea, say so.



PROJECT TIMELINE AND COMMUNICATION:



- Target completion: 4–8 weeks depending on scope and workflow speed

- Weekly check-ins via video call or messaging to review progress and align on direction

- Responsive communication is required — I need to know things are moving

title: Python Developer for Futures Trading Bot (Part-Time Remote)
description:
About Us



We're a small, focused AI trading team that has successfully built and deployed a proprietary futures trading bot. Our bot is live, profitable, and executing trades daily. We're now looking for a skilled Python developer to join us as the dedicated technical owner of this system.



The Opportunity



This is a long-term, part-time remote position (10 hours/week) with significant growth potential. You'll be the technical guardian of our trading bot, ensuring it runs flawlessly and continues to evolve. This role offers the unique opportunity to work at the intersection of software development and quantitative trading, where your code directly impacts real financial outcomes.



What You'll Do



Keep Our Bot Running Smoothly



•

Monitor daily operations and ensure 99%+ uptime



•

Quickly identify and resolve any technical issues



•

Maintain security, update dependencies, and manage infrastructure



Optimize Performance



•

Implement new trading strategies based on our team's research



•

Optimize code for speed and efficiency



•

Conduct backtesting to validate strategy improvements



•

Propose technical enhancements that improve profitability



Collaborate with Our Trading Team



•

Translate trading ideas into clean, robust Python code



•

Provide weekly performance reports and insights



•

Participate in strategy discussions and offer technical guidance



•

Maintain clear documentation of the system



What We're Looking For



Required Skills:



•

Expert-level Python with strong experience in Pandas, NumPy, and data analysis



•

API Integration Experience - You've worked extensively with RESTful and WebSocket APIs, ideally from cryptocurrency or futures exchanges



•

Trading Knowledge - You understand futures markets, order types, leverage, and risk management concepts



•

Infrastructure Skills - Comfortable with Linux, cloud platforms (AWS/GCP), and database management



•

Git Proficiency - Clean commits, clear documentation, version control best practices



Ideal Candidate:



•

Has built or maintained trading bots, algorithmic trading systems, or financial applications



•

Understands the importance of uptime and reliability in live trading environments



•

Can work independently and proactively identify issues before they become problems



•

Excellent written English communication skills



•

Experience working remotely with US-based teams



Work Details



Time Commitment: 10 hours per week (flexible scheduling)



Communication:



•

Daily brief updates via Slack/



•

Weekly 30-minute video call



•

Must be responsive to urgent issues (we'll define clear protocols)



Work Style:



•

Primarily asynchronous work with some scheduled overlap



•

You'll have autonomy to structure your time



•

We value results and reliability over rigid schedules



Why This Role is Great



? Work on a live, profitable system - Your work has immediate, measurable impact



? Long-term partnership - We're looking for someone to grow with us, not a short-term contractor



? Flexible remote work - Work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection



? Learn algorithmic trading - Gain deep insights into quantitative trading strategies



? Small team, big impact - Direct collaboration with the trading team, no corporate bureaucracy



? Competitive compensation - We pay well for quality work and value long-term relationships



How to Apply



Please submit:



1.

Your resume/CV highlighting relevant Python and trading experience



2.

Portfolio or GitHub showing examples of your work (trading bots, API integrations, or similar projects)



3.

Brief cover letter (3-4 paragraphs) answering:



•

What's your experience with trading systems or financial applications?



•

Describe a challenging bug or performance issue you've resolved



•

Why are you interested in working on a futures trading bot?







We'll prioritize candidates who:



•

Have demonstrable experience with trading bots or financial APIs



•

Can provide references from previous remote/international clients



•

Show strong communication skills in their application



Next Steps



Selected candidates will go through:



1.

Initial screening call (15 minutes)



2.

Technical interview (45 minutes) - We'll discuss your experience and approach to common scenarios



3.

Paid trial project (5-10 hours) - A real task from our backlog to assess fit



4.

3-month trial period - Full engagement with the option to continue long-term

title: Senior Media Buyer & Client Account Manager - Life Insurance Lead Generation
description:
Senior Media Buyer & Client Account Manager - Life Insurance Lead Generation



Type: Full-Time



About the Role

We are a fast-growing performance marketing agency managing 20–30 active clients and approximately $100,000 in monthly ad spend. Our clients are life insurance agents and agencies across the United States, and our entire business is built around a single goal: generating high-quality, qualified appointments and leads for them to sell life insurance policies.

We are looking for a highly experienced and autonomous Senior Media Buyer & Client Account Manager to take full ownership of this operation. This is not an entry-level position. The expectation is to maintain a 7% close rate on total leads generated across the client portfolio. This is a demanding role requiring 50-60 hours per week and a high level of commitment.



Who You Are

•A Proven Media Buyer: You have managed 6-7 figures in ad spend on Meta platforms. You live and breathe Ads Manager and know how to scale campaigns profitably.

•A True "Go-Getter": You are a highly autonomous, proactive self-starter. You don’t wait to be told what to do; you identify problems and create solutions.

•An Expert Client Manager: You excel at communication and can confidently manage 20+ client relationships simultaneously via Slack and video calls, providing weekly reports and strategic guidance.

•Tech-Savvy & Fast: You are highly proficient with Slack, GoHighLevel (GHL), Google Meet, and Zoom. You are organized, efficient, and built for a fast-paced environment.

•Obsessed with Performance: You are an analytical thinker who is driven by data and KPIs. You are relentlessly focused on hitting targets and driving measurable results for clients.



What You Will Be Doing

Media Buying & Performance Optimization: You will manage and optimize ad campaigns across all active client accounts on the Meta Ads platform, overseeing a combined monthly spend of ~$100,000. Your primary objective is to hit our client KPI of a 7% close rate on leads generated. This includes making any necessary changes within the ad account and the associated funnels (e.g., in GoHighLevel).

Creative Strategy & High-Volume Testing: You will be responsible for developing, launching, and iterating on 30–50 new ad creatives per week, including both AI video ads and high-performing static image ads.



Full-Cycle Account Management: You are the primary owner of the client relationship. This includes daily communication in Slack, delivering weekly performance reports, and hopping on client calls as needed.



Internal Strategy & Collaboration: You will meet 1-on-1 daily with the agency owner to review performance, align on strategy, and plan priorities.

title: Remote Medical Front Desk & Scheduling Coordinator (U.S. Pain Clinic | ECW/eClinicalWorks)
description:
REMOTE MEDICAL FRONT DESK & SCHEDULING COORDINATOR (U.S. PAIN CLINIC | ECW/eCLINICALWORKS)



TYPE: Full-time (40 hrs/week)

PAY: $5–$7 USD/hour (based on experience) + BONUSES

BONUSES (STRONG PERFORMANCE): 90-DAY BONUS + 180-DAY BONUS

SCHEDULE: Must work U.S. business hours (Central Time)



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a small U.S.-based pain management clinic. This role is phone-heavy and patient-facing. You will be the voice of our clinic and must be professional, calm, and easy to understand by U.S. patients. Training is structured and takes about 2–3 months, so we are looking for someone who wants a long-term position.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- Answer inbound calls from patients (new + established) and resolve issues or route properly

- Schedule new patient appointments and follow-ups; reschedule/cancel as needed

- Make outbound calls to get patients scheduled and confirm appointments

- Handle calls from pharmacies and other medical offices; coordinate messages accurately

- Understand insurance basics and support prior authorization workflow (gather info, follow up, track status)

- Comfortable discussing fees/cash prices and collecting payments per clinic policy

- EHR/ECW tasks (preferred): create new patients, update demographics/insurance, route/assign faxes, create telephone encounters/tasks, document calls clearly



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (PLEASE DO NOT APPLY WITHOUT THIS)

- Minimum 1–2+ years in U.S. healthcare front desk / scheduling / patient access (remote or in-clinic)

- Strong conversational English (clear, confident, natural pacing; easily understood by U.S. callers)

- Strong communication + ability to understand what patients are requesting

- Comfortable being on the phone a large portion of the day

- Basic understanding of U.S. healthcare workflow: insurance, prior authorizations, referrals, copays/deductibles



PREFERRED (STRONG PLUS)

- eClinicalWorks (ECW) experience (especially: new patient creation, fax routing, telephone encounters/tasks)

- Experience in pain management / ortho / spine clinics

- Worked with MedVA / Hello Rache / similar healthcare VA companies

- Light marketing/sales skill for converting inquiries into scheduled appointments



WORK SETUP (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

- Reliable high-speed internet + backup connection plan (mobile hotspot or secondary internet)

- Quiet private workspace suitable for HIPAA-sensitive calls

- Working headset + microphone

- Webcam/camera available for training and check-ins

- No overemployment during scheduled hours (this role requires focus and consistency)



COMPLIANCE

- Willing to provide NBI Clearance (Philippines) AFTER a conditional offer / BEFORE start date

- Willing to follow confidentiality/HIPAA processes and clinic SOPs



HOW TO APPLY (FOLLOW EXACTLY OR YOU WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED)

1) Start your application message with: FRONT DESK READY



2) Answer these 6 questions (short but specific):

- Q1: How many years have you worked as a U.S. healthcare front desk / scheduler, and what specialty?

- Q2: Describe your ECW experience (be specific: new patient creation, fax routing, tasks/telephone encounters, scheduling).

- Q3: What is a prior authorization, and what steps have you personally handled?

- Q4: Write your exact spoken response to: “Do you take my insurance?” (2–4 sentences)

- Q5: How would you respond to an upset patient who says: “Nobody called me back”? (2–4 sentences)

- Q6: Confirm YES/NO to each: (a) can work U.S. Central Time consistently, (b) have reliable internet + backup plan, (c) not working another job during the same scheduled hours, (d) have a webcam for training.



3) VOICE RECORDING (REQUIRED): 60–90 seconds, MP3 or M4A

Read this script (word-for-word is fine):

“Thank you for calling our clinic. This is (Name). How can I help you today?

If you’re calling to schedule a new patient appointment, I can help with that.

May I have your full name, date of birth, and the best call-back number?”



SUBMIT YOUR AUDIO USING OPTION A (ATTACH FILE OR GOOGLE DRIVE LINK)

A) CREATE THE AUDIO FILE (MP3 OR M4A)

Choose ONE method:



- iPhone (Voice Memos):

  - Open the Voice Memos app

  - Record 60–90 seconds

  - Tap the recording, then tap the Share icon

  - Choose “Save to Files” (this creates an M4A file)

  - Rename it like: LASTNAME_FIRSTNAME_FRONTDESK.m4a



- Android (Voice Recorder):

  - Open your Voice Recorder app

  - Record 60–90 seconds

  - Save/export as M4A or MP3

  - Rename it like: LASTNAME_FIRSTNAME_FRONTDESK.mp3



- Laptop/PC:

  - Use any recorder app/software to record 60–90 seconds

  - Save/export as MP3 or M4A

  - Rename it like: LASTNAME_FIRSTNAME_FRONTDESK.mp3



B) SUBMIT THE AUDIO (CHOOSE 1)

- Option 1 (Preferred): Attach the MP3/M4A file directly in your OnlineJobs.ph application message (if attachments are available to you).

- Option 2: Google Drive link

  - Upload the MP3/M4A to Google Drive

  - Right-click the file (or tap the three dots on mobile) and select “Share”

  - Under “General access,” change to: Anyone with the link

  - Set role to: Viewer

  - Copy the link and paste it into your OnlineJobs.ph application message



IMPORTANT

- Do NOT
 the audio. Submit via OnlineJobs.ph message only (attachment or Google Drive link).

- Applications that follow instructions completely will be prioritized.

title: Virtual Assistant Needed to Help Set Up Jane App for Telehealth Medical Practice
description:
I am looking for a reliable virtual assistant to assist with setup of my Jane App electronic health record for a telehealth primary care and medical practice.



Services include sick visits, acute care visits, medical weight management, women's health visits, prescription management, documentation services, and medical consultations.



Responsibilities include creating appointment types, setting visit durations, entering services and pricing, uploading intake and consent forms, organizing provider schedules, enabling reminders, and assisting with online booking setup based on instructions provided.



Experience with healthcare administration or EHR systems is preferred but not required. Training and step by step guidance will be provided.



This is a short term project estimated at ten to twenty five hours over one to two weeks. Attention to detail and good communication skills are required.

title: Social Media Manager for Telehealth Medical Practice
description:
I am looking for a social media manager to help grow and manage social media accounts for a telehealth primary care medical practice.



Responsibilities include creating and scheduling posts, developing healthcare related content, managing Instagram and
 pages, responding to comments or messages when needed, and helping increase online visibility and patient engagement.



Content will focus on primary care services, sick visits, medical weight management, women's health, wellness education, and telehealth services.



Experience managing business or healthcare social media accounts is preferred. Basic graphic design skills using Canva or similar tools are required.



This is an ongoing part time role estimated at five to ten hours per week.

title: ADVANCED VIDEO EDITOR
description:
Senior Video Editor (Adobe Premiere Pro & After Effects) – Long-Term, Full-Time Potential



Overview-

We are a fast-growing creative media company undergoing a full business restructure and expansion. We produce high-volume, high-quality short-form and long-form video content for brands, creators, and businesses across multiple industries.

We are seeking elite-level video editors in the Philippines to join our core team long-term. This is not a short-term gig. We are looking for editors who want stability, growth, and ownership within a structured, professional editing pipeline.



Only experienced editors with excellent English communication skills and a proven professional portfolio will be considered.



Core Responsibilities:

Edit short-form and long-form video content efficiently and accurately

Execute clean, modern, fast-paced edits optimized for social media platforms

Apply advanced cuts, pacing, captions, sound design, and visual polish

Use Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects at an advanced level

Follow creative direction, brand guidelines, and written/video instructions

Meet strict deadlines without exception

Collaborate with other editors, producers, and project leads

Problem-solve independently when files, footage, or instructions are unclear

Adapt quickly to feedback and revisions

Maintain consistent quality across high output volumes



Mandatory Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

Applicants who do not meet all requirements below will not be considered.

10/10 English proficiency (spoken and written)

4+ years of professional video editing experience

Expert-level Adobe Premiere Pro skills

Expert-level Adobe After Effects skills

Proven ability to edit quickly without sacrificing quality

Ability to submit projects on or before deadlines

Ability to understand English creative concepts, tone, and intent

Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends when needed

Willingness to work overtime during high-volume periods

Strong team collaboration and communication skills

Strong independent problem-solving ability

Reliable internet connection and professional workstation

Portfolio submission is required (best work only)



Preferred (Strong Advantages)

Experience editing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts

Experience working in an agency or high-output content environment

Strong sense of pacing, storytelling, and viewer retention

Experience with captions, subtitles, and social-optimized formatting

Familiarity with 
, Google Drive workflows, and shared project pipelines

Understanding of brand consistency and content systems

Ability to follow SOPs while improving workflows proactively

Personal Traits We Are Looking For

Extremely reliable and deadline-driven

Detail-oriented and quality-focused

Calm under pressure during high workloads

Coachable, open to feedback, and improvement-oriented

Proactive communicator (does not wait until deadlines to raise issues)

Long-term mindset — interested in growing with the company



What We Offer

Long-term, stable work with consistent volume

Clear systems, workflows, and expectations

Opportunity to become a core team editor as the company scales

Performance-based growth opportunities and increased responsibility

Professional, structured environment (not freelance chaos)



How to Apply

To be considered, you must submit:

A brief introduction about yourself

Your best video editing portfolio (links only)

Your total years of professional editing experience

Confirmation that you meet all mandatory requirements

Applications without a portfolio will not be reviewed.

mbers with accounting-related questions

title: Dedicated Executive Assistant to the Founder & CEO
description:
Position Title: Executive Assistant to the Founder & CEO



Organizations: Wizearly, Inc. & Oakland Natives Give Back (ONGB)

Location: Remote (U.S.-based preferred)

Type: Full-Time (Part-Time to Start, With Potential for Full-Time for the Right Candidate)

Reports To: Founder & CEO, Dr. Nyeisha DeWitt



About the Role



We are seeking an experienced and exceptionally capable Executive Assistant to support the Founder & CEO of two mission-driven organizations: Wizearly, an AI-powered edtech startup focused on solving chronic absenteeism, and Oakland Natives Give Back (ONGB), a nonprofit advancing educational success.



This role requires a seasoned professional who is not only highly organized, loyal, and discreet, but also fluent in the digital tools and technologies that power modern work. The right candidate will be proactive, anticipate needs, and operate as a trusted partner to the CEO, managing information, optimizing systems, and ensuring the seamless coordination of priorities across both organizations.



Key Responsibilities

Executive & Administrative Support



Manage a fast-moving calendar and schedule meetings across multiple organizations and time zones.



Anticipate the CEO’s needs and prepare all necessary materials for meetings, travel, and decision-making.



Draft, proof, and send professional correspondence and communications.



Prepare executive briefings, follow-up summaries, and reports.



Handle travel logistics, itineraries, and expense tracking with precision.



Maintain confidentiality and sound judgment in all interactions.



Operations & Project Management



Create and manage systems to track priorities, projects, contacts, and deliverables in Notion, Airtable, and ClickUp or similar tools.



Streamline workflows using Zapier, Make (Integromat), or other automation platforms.



Manage internal communications, team coordination, and key project milestones.



Ensure projects are executed on time with detailed follow-up and accountability.



Technology & AI Expertise



Advanced user of ChatGPT, Notion AI, and other AI productivity tools for drafting, summarizing, planning, and automating workflows.



Skilled in creating templates, dashboards, and automations to optimize efficiency.



Confident working across integrated tech stacks, Google Workspace, Slack, Zoom, CRM systems, and cloud-based collaboration tools—without supervision.



Social Media & Communications Support



Manage and schedule professional social content across LinkedIn, Instagram, and X.



Repurpose written or recorded content into polished, platform-ready posts.



Coordinate with designers or editors when needed and ensure brand alignment.



Track engagement data and prepare light analytics reports.



Research & Reporting



Conduct structured research on potential investors, partners, technology platforms, and education-related trends.



Prepare high-quality, concise executive summaries and briefing documents.



Support the creation of grant, investor, and strategic presentation materials.



Required Skills & Experience



4+ years of experience as an Executive Assistant, Chief of Staff, or Operations Manager supporting a Founder or C-suite executive.



Advanced proficiency in all of the following tools (no training provided):



Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendar, Drive)



Notion & Airtable



ChatGPT and/or other AI productivity tools



Project management tools (ClickUp, Asana, or 
)



Automation platforms (Zapier, Make, or similar)



Slack, Zoom, and Canva



Exceptional writing and communication skills; able to draft professional
s, reports, and social content.



Expert multitasker with extraordinary attention to detail and accuracy.



Self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, mission-driven environments and can manage competing priorities gracefully.



High integrity, professionalism, and emotional intelligence.



Preferred



Prior experience in a startup or nonprofit environment.



Familiarity with education, edtech, or philanthropic sectors.



Light design or content creation experience (Canva, short video editing).



Compensation & Growth



Competitive compensation commensurate with experience. The role begins part-time and may transition to full-time quickly based on performance and organizational needs. Long-term growth opportunities exist within both organizations.

title: Bookkeeping & Finance Coordinator (Hospitality) – Remote, Part-time
description:
Are you a master of organization, reconciliation, and financial clarity? We are looking for an experienced Bookkeeping & Finance Coordinator to take full control of our monthly financial preparation.



This is not an accounting role; you will be our internal engine. Your goal is to ensure our books are so clean, organized, and reconciled that our external accountant can file our taxes without having to ask a single question.



The Role

We are a hospitality business that needs a reliable partner to manage our monthly finance cycle. You will be responsible for getting us "accountant-ready" by the 10th of every month.



Your responsibilities include:



- Reconciling all bank and credit card transactions.

- Collecting, digitizing, and filing all invoices and receipts.

- Matching income streams (
, Stripe, Cloudbeds, etc.).

- Categorizing expenses by property and budget category.

- Maintaining a pristine Google Drive folder structure.

- Providing clear, concise notes on any discrepancies or missing items.



Requirements

Proven Experience: Demonstrated track record of reconciling bank statements and organizing financial documents.

Tech Savvy: Expert proficiency in Google Drive and Excel/Google Sheets.

Communication: Fluent in English (written and verbal).



Nice to Have: Experience with Xero, QuickBooks, or Holded; prior experience in the hospitality/short-term rental industry; basic awareness of Spanish invoices/tax documentation.



Availability: Starting at 10–15 hours/week (with potential to ramp up).

title: TikTok Shop Video Editor & Content Assistant (Long-Term Growth Role)
description:

This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants stable work and to grow with a business.



The main goal is to help produce 4+ TikTok Shop videos daily and at least 1 regular short-form video. Video volume may increase as the business grows.





PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY — TikTok Shop Video Editing (80%)



-Edit multiple TikTok Shop product videos daily (sales-driven content, high volume)

-Edit short-form videos for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

-Remove pauses and dead space

-Create strong hooks in the first 3 seconds

-Add engaging captions and on-screen text

-Edit for retention and conversion (not cinematic style)

-Create fast-paced, attention-grabbing edits

-Help optimize videos for product sales

-Support daily posting consistency

Videos are typically 30 seconds to 3 minutes.





SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITIES — Content Support (20%)



-Organize video files in Google Drive

-Assist with uploading content

-Support content workflow

-Help with social media operations later as the company grows

Role responsibilities will expand over time.





REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



-Strong experience editing TikTok or short-form vertical content

-Experience editing TikTok Shop, product reviews, or UGC content preferred

-Must understand marketing hooks and retention editing

-Must understand conversion-focused editing (sales videos)

-Must be able to edit quickly and meet deadlines

-Familiar with CapCut, Premiere Pro, DaVinci, or similar tools

-Strong English communication

-Reliable internet and backup power

-Looking for long-term work





WORK DETAILS



Part-time: 10 hours per week to start

Pay: $6/hour

Opportunity for increased hours and pay based on performance





APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (READ CAREFULLY)

title: Real Estate Technical VA – AI SEO & Content Management
description:
I am looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to help update my real estate website for Generative Engine Optimization (GEO).  The goal is to ensure my services are recognized and recommended by AI platforms.



This is a technical execution role.  I have already developed the specific instructions and strategy; I need a partner to execute the "grind" of the work.  You will be using my Peec.ai account to identify high-value search prompts and a widget and ai to implement the content updates.



Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis: Review visibility data in Peec.ai to identify and prioritize prompts with 4 and 5-bar frequency statuses and others that I may select, which are appropriate for my industry.



Content Implementation: Take high-frequency search topics that are recommended and generate/edit professional, persuasive content to address them.  Most of the work here is done by ai.  Your job is to follow the instructions and create the content using the tools I provide.  Ultimately, you'll create the content in draft form, and I will do my final review and publish.  



Website Updates: Accurately place content into my Squarespace website in draft format for me to review and publish.



Quality Control: Ensure instructions are carried out exactly as specified, and communicate with me if there are any questions or concerns.



Requirements:

-- English fluency (written, reading, and spoken) is a strict requirement.

-- Ability to follow detailed instructions accurately and without skipping steps.

--Experience with GEO/ Ai SEO, and content management. 

--Experience with Squarespace websites.



Bonuses (if you have experience with any of these, that is more attractive to me):

-- Familiarity with real estate terminology.

-- Experience with writing, editing, and proofreading.

-- Experience using AI tools (Gemini, ChatGPT, Copilot, Claude, etc) to refine and professionalize content.

-- Experience with Peec or other similar tools to help with GEO/ Ai SEO, etc.



This is a long-term relationship.  Iniitally, there will be more hours required to get setup.  I would estimate 20-40 hours of work per week to get started for a week or two and then 5-20 hours per week to maintain.

title: Leasing + Property Management Coordinator VA (US LTR) – Part-Time 20 hrs/wk (9AM–1PM ET)
description:
We need an organized, operations-minded VA who is great at follow-up. The job is to run lease-up (inquiries -> showings -> applications -> lease signing) and keep maintenance + rent follow-ups moving, using RentRedi + trackers. If you never drop tasks and you live by checklists, this will be a great fit.



No bookkeeping. No QuickBooks.



GROWTH PATH



This role has a strong path to more hours and full-time (9AM–5PM ET) after a successful 90-day trial, based on performance and business needs.



REQUIRED SCHEDULE

Mon–Fri, 9:00 AM–1:00 PM US Eastern

No overlapping job during these hours

Quick check (KPI): Mon–Fri 4:30–5:00 PM ET for urgent tenant messages + MTR check-in issues only.

During shift hours, we aim to respond to leasing/tenant messages within 1 business hour.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES (PHASE 1 – NOW)

Lease-Up (Core)

- Respond to inquiries using templates

- Pre-screen prospects + schedule showings

- Track applications + follow up for missing items

- Coordinate screening steps and move qualified applicants to signed lease

- Move-in coordination (funds, utilities start, portal setup)



PM Ops (Core)

- Maintenance coordination: collect details/photos, schedule vendors, follow up to completion

- Rent follow-up: send reminders using templates + document notes/promises-to-pay

- Turnovers: coordinate cleaners/vendors + checklist + photos

- Keep trackers and Drive folders updated daily

- Help enforce portal-first communication (RentRedi)



MTR/STR (Bonus)

We have two MTRs (typical stays ~2 months) and only use STR to fill vacancies. If you have MTR/STR ops experience, you can earn extra per event (details below).



MUST-HAVES

- Philippines-based

- US LTR leasing and/or property management support experience (Airbnb-only is not enough)

- Strong written English + clear spoken English (video required)

- Very organized + strong follow-up habits

- Comfortable with Google Sheets/Drive

- Reliable internet + backup connection

- Comfortable joining a 5-minute live call during the final interview stage.



NOT A FIT IF

Airbnb-only experience (no leasing/LTR PM), or you cannot commit to the required schedule.



PAY / BONUSES

Salary is PHP 27,500–30,000/month based on KPI performance.

KPI Bonus: PHP 2,500/month (performance-based).

MTR/STR bonus pay (optional): PHP 1,500 per turnover; PHP 500 per check-in day.



HOW TO APPLY (REQUIRED)

If you do not answer all questions + include video + resume, we will skip your application.

Put “PM022826” on the first line of your OLJ message.



1. Confirm you can work Mon–Fri 9AM–1PM ET with no overlap job.

2. Confirm you can do the 4:30–5:00 PM ET quick check (Mon–Fri).

3. Years of US leasing and/or LTR PM support experience:

4. Lease-up workflow in 6 steps (inquiry -> showing -> application -> screening -> lease -> move-in):

5. Maintenance coordination workflow in 5 steps:

6. Late rent follow-up cadence:

7. Tools used (RentRedi/AppFolio/Buildium/etc.):

8. Internet speed + backup connection:

9. VIDEO LINK (Required): 90 seconds–2.5 minutes using the script below. Important: Say PM022826 at the end of your video.

10. Resume: attach in OLJ OR Google Drive link

If using Google Drive, set sharing to “Anyone with the link can view.”



Shortlisted applicants receive a short form + paid skills test.



VIDEO SCRIPT (Required) – 90 seconds to 2.5 minutes

Record a quick video (Loom or unlisted YouTube). No editing needed. Answer in order:



1. Name + schedule confirmation - Name, City/Province, confirm Mon–Fri 9–1 ET + Mon–Fri 4:30–5:00 ET quick check.

2. Lease-up - Briefly describe one lease-up you handled and your 6 steps (inquiry -> showing -> application -> screening -> lease -> move-in).

3. Maintenance coordination - Your 5-step process from first tenant message to completion.

4. Late rent follow-up - Your cadence (Day 1/3/5 etc.) and how you log promises-to-pay.

5. Tools + portal-first - Tools you’ve used (RentRedi or similar + Google Sheets). Confirm you’re comfortable with a portal-first approach.

6. Internet + close - Internet speed + backup, and one sentence on why you’re great at follow-up/trackers.

Also confirm: “I’m comfortable speaking with tenants/vendors/prospects when needed.”



End by saying: “My application code is PM022826.”

title: Tutoring Remote Work - Fresh Nursing Grads or RNs ONLY
description:
Online Healthcare Tutor Clinical Documentation Improvement Track



“Fresh Nursing Graduates or Registered Nurses Welcome”



Nonprofit Academic Initiative Philippines

Gig Based Compensation



We are currently in the early development stage of a nonprofit academic initiative focused on strengthening healthcare education and building a future Clinical Documentation Improvement group in the Philippines. At this time, planning and deliberation are ongoing as we carefully structure the program.



Our long term goal is to create structured opportunities for nursing graduates, both fresh and experienced, to participate in Clinical Documentation Improvement work. CDI is a growing field in healthcare where nurses excel because of their clinical background, critical thinking, and understanding of patient care. With additional knowledge in medical coding and documentation standards, nurses can transition into valuable documentation improvement roles.



We are seeking Bachelor of Science in Nursing graduates, including fresh graduates, to provide online tutoring and academic guidance in healthcare related subjects. Registered Nurses are preferred but not required.



This role begins on a gig basis. As the initiative develops and if the project progresses successfully, a more structured engagement plan may be discussed.



Role Responsibilities



Provide structured online tutoring in healthcare and nursing subjects

Assist students in improving academic performance

Support understanding of clinical documentation standards

Introduce basic medical coding awareness

Help develop foundational materials for future CDI training

Monitor student progress and provide feedback



Qualifications



Bachelor of Science in Nursing required

Fresh graduates welcome

RN license preferred but not mandatory

Strong academic performance required

Interest in clinical documentation and medical coding is an advantage

Professional, responsible, and detail oriented



Compensation



This is a gig based opportunity with performance based compensation. Further structure will be discussed as the program advances.

title: ???? Full-Stack Developer (Remote)
description:
We're building Trakie — the first AI-powered inventory receiving platform for cannabis dispensaries. Think: a Inventory manager takes a photo of an invoice, and our system automatically reads it, matches it to their POS system, and fills everything in. No more manual data entry. No more errors. Just done.



We're a funded early-stage startup (Delaware C-Corp) moving fast. We need one sharp developer who can own the product end to end.



---



WHAT YOU'LL BUILD:



? OCR pipeline that reads cannabis invoices and extracts product data (name, SKU, quantity, price)

? Claude AI (Anthropic) integration for intelligent document parsing and autofill

? API integrations with METRC (cannabis compliance) and Dutchie (POS system)

? Clean web dashboard where dispensary staff upload invoices and verify autofilled data



---



YOU NEED:



? 3+ years full-stack experience (React or Next.js + Node.js or Python)

? Experience with OCR tools (Google Vision, AWS Textract, or similar)

? REST API integration experience — you've connected third party systems before

? Ability to work independently and communicate clearly in English

? Portfolio of real SaaS or web app projects you can show us





WHAT WE OFFER:



? Fully remote, flexible hours

title: Dating App Manager (Hinge + Tinder) – Full-Time | Experienced Only

Swipe strategically based on my exact type (I’ll provide examples)



Start and carry natural, confident, flirty conversations in my tone

Pace activity properly to avoid flags or throttling



Work Dubai timezone (morning + evening shifts preferred)

Full-time. Performance-based.

title: Senior Accountant – Remote | Full-Time | USD Salary
description:
About Aidventure

Aidventure is a growing accounting and AI consulting firm serving small and mid-sized businesses across North America. We work in a fast-paced, remote-first environment where ownership, communication, and reliability are non-negotiable. We’re a small team that moves fast and holds each other to a high standard.

The Role

We’re looking for a Senior Accountant to own our client accounting operations end to end. This is a full-time remote position, paid in USD, working directly with the founder. You won’t just execute tasks — you’ll build and own the systems that keep our clients financially healthy and organized.

What You’ll Own

 - Month-end close process for multiple US-based clients — building and executing checklists

 - QuickBooks Online and Xero bookkeeping and reconciliations

 - Client invoicing, payment follow-up, and aging reports

 - Cash flow monitoring and financial reporting

 - Managing and reviewing the work of a junior bookkeeper

 - Building and documenting accounting SOPs so the team operates without bottlenecks

What We Expect From You

 - Proactive daily communication — you update us, we don’t chase you

 - Full-time availability, 40 hours per week

 - Overlap with US Eastern time zone for at least 6 hours daily

 - You flag problems early, not after they’ve compounded

 - You build processes, not just complete tasks

 - Comfortable working independently with minimal hand-holding

Requirements

 - 5+ years of accounting experience

 - Strong English — written and verbal

 - Hands-on experience with QuickBooks Online and/or Xero

 - Experience working with US-based clients or employers preferred

 - Degree in Accounting or Finance

 - CPA or equivalent certification is a plus

Nice to Have

 - Experience in a multi-client or outsourced accounting environment

 - Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT or Claude

 - Experience with project management tools like Notion or ClickUp

 - FP&A or financial reporting experience

Compensation

$800 – $1,200/month USD based on experience, paid monthly.

To Apply

Please include your CV and a brief note on your experience with QuickBooks Online and one example of a process or system you built or improved in a previous role.

title: Facebook Ads Media Buyer
description:
We’re Not Hiring “Ad Experts.” We’re Hiring People Who Learn Fast and Execute Cleanly.

(PLEASE DO NOT REPLY DIRECTLY TO THIS POST. IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO APPLY, FOLLOW THE STEPS AT THE END.)



Pay: Negotiable flat rate per 2-week period (USD), based on experience

Pay Timing: Paid once every 2 weeks. 80 hours per period, agreed upon at hire

Location: Remote (Philippines-based applicants only)

Role Type: Full-time | Long-term

Openings: 5 Media Buyer roles

Team Scope: Executes media buying under the Lead Media Buyer and Ops system



Why This Role Exists

Meta Ads rewards discipline, not guessing.

At Black Hat Strategy, performance doesn’t come from hacks or shortcuts. It comes from interpreting signals correctly, following systems, and making fewer — better — decisions.



We’re hiring five Media Buyers to execute inside a proven framework. Prior ad experience is helpful, but not required. What matters more is your ability to think analytically, follow process, and learn quickly.



This role exists so:

Campaigns are managed consistently

Budgets are paced correctly

Creative tests are structured, not random

Performance changes are interpreted before actions are taken



This is not a “figure it out as you go” role.

This is a learn fast, execute clean role.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing

You will not be left guessing.

You will be trained and supported.



As a Media Buyer, you will:

Manage Meta ad accounts for ecommerce brands

Launch and maintain campaigns using predefined structures

Monitor performance signals and pacing daily

Make changes only when signals justify it

Document actions and observations inside ClickUp

Flag issues early instead of reacting late

Escalate when something truly feels off — not every dip

Structured check-in with the Lead Media Buyer (if applicable)



You are not expected to know everything on day one.

You are expected to learn quickly and follow the system.



What This Role Owns (From the SOP)

Day-to-day campaign execution

Budget pacing and spend stability

Structured creative testing

Signal observation and documentation

Following escalation rules exactly as written

ClickUp task hygiene and update consistency



If performance changes, this role:

Observes first

Interprets second

Acts third



This Role Is for Someone Who…

Comes from an analytical or data-driven background

 (analytics, operations, finance, QA, engineering, reporting, etc.)

Learns new tools and systems quickly

Is comfortable working with numbers and patterns

Can follow processes without cutting corners

Documents their work clearly and consistently

Stays calm when results fluctuate

You don’t need to be a media buying “expert.”

You do need to be sharp, curious, and disciplined.



This Role Is Not for Someone Who…

Wants full creative or strategic freedom

Needs constant reassurance or hand-holding

Makes changes based on gut feelings

Struggles with structure or documentation

Dislikes feedback or process

How You’ll Work With the Team

Operating Cadence & Communication

Lead Media Buyer sets standards… you execute within them

Escalation & Recovery Lead diagnoses issues… you provide clean inputs and context

Project Manager ensures flow… you keep your work visible and documented

Ops Head sets direction… you stay aligned and consistent



You are not operating alone.

You are part of a system.



Why You’ll Like Working Here

Clear training and expectations

Supportive learning environment

No chaos, no guessing

Leadership that values thinking and precision

Long-term role with growth into senior buying or leadership



We don’t reward noise.

We reward good judgment.



Application Process

PLEASE DO NOT JUST REPLY TO THIS POST ON THE JOB BOARD.

To be considered, you must complete ALL STEPS BELOW.

The Google Form is your Online Interview.



Step 1: Take a short online IQ test

We respect intelligence and we think you probably do too.

Go to the Fast Learner Free IQ Test and complete it

Create a free account at the end

Save the results URL for Step 3

?? Applicants without a valid link will not be considered



Step 2: Record a 2–3 minute Loom video (camera ON)

Create a free account at Loom

Speak clearly in English

Tell us:

Your paid media experience

How you think about optimization and ROAS

How you’ve helped others improve performance

Save the Loom URL for Step 3



Step 3: Complete the Online Interview

NO AI ALLOWED. We want to hear you.

Open the Application Form

Enter your contact details

Paste:

IQ test results link

Loom video link

Answer all questions honestly and thoughtfully

Your answers matter more than perfect formatting.



Step 4: Live Video Interview (camera on)

This is where we get to know how you think.

I personally review every candidate who completes the steps above and will reach out directly to those who feel like the right fit.



If this role speaks to you, good.

That means you’re probably the kind of person we’re looking for.

Bring your best.

We’ll bring the system.



Link to Online Interview Form:

title: SparkBox
description:
ABOUT US



SparkBox is a relationship ecosystem designed to help couples maintain curiosity, connection, and intimacy in their relationship.



WE OFFER
