title: Remote Creative Project Manager / Quality Control Manager
description:
Job Title

Remote Creative Project Manager / Quality Control Manager



Location

Remote – Philippines



Type

Part-time (10–20 hours per week)

Long-term collaboration



--

About Us



We are a fast-growing European marketing agency working with retail brands and local businesses.



We build scalable content systems, high-converting campaigns and social media frameworks.



We work with international freelancers and need a strong operations-focused project manager to protect quality and keep production organized.



This is not a creative influencer role.

This is a structured, detail-oriented operations role.



—



Core Responsibility



Your job is to protect quality and process.



You will manage external freelancers (video editors, designers, content creators) and ensure that all deliverables meet our brand and technical standards before they are sent to the client.



You are the filter between production and the CEO.



The CEO should only see work that is ready for approval.



—



Language Requirement (Important)



Many of our projects are in Dutch.



You must:



• Be able to read and understand Dutch text

• Detect spelling mistakes in Dutch subtitles

• Compare voice-over audio with on-screen subtitles

• Identify obvious grammatical errors



You do not need to speak Dutch fluently, but you must be comfortable reviewing Dutch content with high accuracy.



Applications without Dutch comprehension will not be considered.



—



Key Tasks



• Review video reels and social media content

• Check brand consistency (fonts, colors, layout)

• Check Dutch subtitles and spelling

• Check safe zones for Instagram and

• Verify export format (9:16, correct resolution)

• Ensure naming conventions are followed

• Ensure deadlines are respected

• Communicate revisions clearly to freelancers

• Maintain organized Google Drive folders

• Track task progress in project management tools



You do not need to create content.

You need to protect standards.



—



Requirements



• Strong attention to detail

• Excellent written English

• Practical understanding of Dutch (reading level required)

• Experience managing creative freelancers

• Experience reviewing social media content

• Organized and process-driven

• Calm under pressure

• Able to follow structured guidelines



Bonus:

• Experience with European brands

• Experience in retail marketing

• Basic understanding of Meta platforms



—



Compensation



Hourly rate: 8–12 USD per hour depending on experience



Part-time start (10–20 hours per week)

Possibility to grow into a larger role as the agency scales



Long-term opportunity for the right person.
salary: 8–12 USD per hour depending on experienc

title: Meta Ads Execution Specialist (Part-Time)
description:
About Us

We’re a programming education company that helps experienced software engineers build real-world Rust projects and land Rust roles. We run a high-ticket, cohort-based accelerator plus self-paced training, and reach engineers through YouTube,
, and partnerships.



Role Overview

We are looking for a part-time Meta Ads Operator to implement and maintain our
 and Instagram campaigns. This is an execution-focused role: you will take clear targeting and creative direction from the founder and marketing team, then handle setup, tracking, and ongoing optimizations inside Meta Ads Manager.



Ideal for someone who enjoys clean accounts, accurate tracking, and making data-driven tweaks, not sitting in branding meetings.



Key Responsibilities

1. Implement and maintain Meta Pixel and Conversion API across our funnels (waitlist, applications, bookings, purchases).

2. Set up campaigns, ad sets, and ads according to provided specs (objectives, budgets, audiences, and creatives).

3. Create and manage custom and lookalike audiences from our traffic,
 list, and engaged users.

4. Monitor performance daily on weekdays and execute simple rules: pause obvious losers, keep winners within defined guardrails, and flag issues quickly.

5. Run basic A/B tests on creatives and audiences following our testing framework.

6. Ensure tracking events fire correctly on all key steps and troubleshoot when they do not.

7. Produce a concise weekly report (spend, cost per waitlist opt-in, cost per application, cost per call, cost per student) with 2 to 3 clear recommendations.



You Are A Good Fit If

1. You have 1 to 3 years of hands-on experience running Meta Ads (lead gen or info/education experience is a plus).

2. You are comfortable with Meta Ads Manager, Pixel, standard events, and basic CAPI.

3. You can read numbers and make simple performance-based decisions without drama.

4. You are organized, responsive, and document what you do so others can follow it.

5. You can overlap at least 2 to 3 hours per day with US time zones.

6. You’re currently freelancing or working part time and want a long term core client, not just a one-off project.



This Role Is Not

1. Not a creative director or copywriter (we have a content and
 team).

2. Not a CMO or growth strategist d
 offers, funnels, or pricing.

3. Not a general social media manager (no organic posting, community management, or influencer work).



Scope & Engagement

1. Part-time contractor.

2. We’ll start at 5–10 hours/week for the first 60–90 days while we validate and scale Meta.

3. We guarantee a minimum of 20 hours/month, paid monthly, so your time is predictable.

4. If performance is strong and we scale ad spend, this role can grow into 15–20+ hours/week and potentially a full-time PH position.

5. Remote, flexible schedule as long as SLAs are met and campaigns are monitored on weekdays.



How To Apply



Please reply to this job post with the following:

1. A brief summary of your Meta Ads experience, including typical monthly budgets.

2. Screenshots or summaries of 2 to 3 campaigns you have managed (goal, budget, structure, and results).

3. One paragraph on how you normally set up tracking (pixel, events, CAPI) for a lead gen funnel.

4. Your part-time hourly rate and full-time monthly rate, respectively.

Who We AreYou are a highly driven, proactive, and detail-oriented team player who thrives on helping others succeed. You take ownership of client results, love systems and checklists, and are confident in communicating with people from all walks of life. You’re resourceful, solution-oriented, and constantly looking for ways to improve processes, client outcomes, and team performance.

We are Singapore’s fastest growing performance marketing agency that specialises in helping speakers, coaches and service-based businesses build and scale million dollar offers through paid ads, funnels, and high-level mentorship.

We are seeking a Success Manager to support and manage our software clients (Funnel Creation Kit), mentorship students, and high-touch private clients — ensuring they receive world-class support, get results fast, and stay engaged throughout their journey with us.

RELATIONSHIPS & COMMUNITY

title: Sales Closer for SaaS Partnership Offer
description:
Closer for SaaS Partnership Offer



We are looking for a reliable and professional part-time inbound sales caller / closer to help us speak with warm prospects and close simple partnership calls.



About the offer



We work with 2 SaaS products that are offered to creators, educators, and online business owners as partnership opportunities.



The model is simple:



creators can recommend the SaaS to their audience or clients



they earn recurring revenue share



we help them monetize without building software themselves



Your job is not hard selling.

The offer is simple, interesting, and easy to explain.



We already have 2 outreachers booking calls, so you will mainly be handling scheduled calls and helping interested prospects understand the opportunity.



What you will do



Attend scheduled sales / partnership calls



Explain the opportunity clearly and confidently



Answer simple questions from prospects



Help move interested prospects toward becoming partners



Follow a clear call structure / script



Send follow-up messages after calls if needed



Keep basic notes on each call



Compensation



$100/month fixed



Based on 5 hours per week of availability



Equivalent to $5/hour



Plus $50 for each closed call



This means you have both:



a small fixed monthly payment



performance upside for each successful close



Who this is for



This role is a good fit if you are:



comfortable speaking English on calls



confident talking to online business owners / creators



good at explaining offers in a simple way



organized and reliable



available weekly for calls



interested in sales, partnerships, SaaS, or online business



Ideal candidate



We would love someone who has experience in one or more of these:



sales calls



appointment closing



affiliate / partnership offers



SaaS sales



online coaching / digital product space



outreach follow-up



You do not need to be super technical.

context on the offer

a clear explanation of the products



guidance on how to handle the calls

This role is designed to be simple and low-stress.

You will not need to do cold outreach.

You will mainly be speaking with booked prospects and helping close aligned opportunities.
